product_name: Simo Solis Lite Mobile Wi-Fi Hotspot (HS610000)
comment: I bought the Solis unit to be used as a portal mobile Wi-Fi in my vehicle as some places that I travel through for my job are not always cell friendly. There is a particular stretch of rural highway that I travel frequently where my Verizon cell goes to zero bars in spots. I had success with a built in AT&T Wi-Fi in my previous vehicle but my replacement vehicle did not have a built in so I purchased the Solis as it advertised that it would automatically lock onto the strongest network in the area. Needless to say, I have been extremely disappointed. In the areas that I need it most, it will take a very long time to lock on to a signal and will not always stay locked in. This is especially frustrating when I'm supposed to be on a Teams meeting for work while driving. I called tech support and explained my issue and told them how the previous AT&T Wi-Fi unit I was using had very little trouble in this area but for some reason the Solis would not lock onto the AT&T signal on a consistent basis. I was told to do a reset on the unit. That really didn't work. Sometimes the unit would work fine in the rural areas but it would not lock in on a good signal on a regular basis and I got tired of pulling over to try to work with it. I think this would probably work fine as a "sit in one place" device in an area that is not out in the middle of nowhere...although AT&T still works there......but as a mobile Wi-Fi for your vehicle, it's awful. Since I've had it for almost 6 months, I guess I'm stuck with it so I'll use up the data I've pre-purchased and then do who knows what with it.

product_name: Simo Solis Lite Mobile Wi-Fi Hotspot (HS610000)
comment:
I researched hotspots prior to some lengthy trips in Europe this last year. Skyroam was newer to the game, but strongly recommended. I've had the, "puck" nicknamed after its hockey puck shape overseas 9 out of 12 months. ES, IT, England, FR, DE, Switzerland, Amsterdam, Belgium, Iceland, Sweden, Thailand and Norway. No problems at all. The shape fits in your front pocket easy. Doesn't slide around on a car dash. At first, I wasn't sure of the color, but it's easy to not lose because it stands out. The cell phone app works great. Easy to turn subscriptions on and off at will.

Austin helped me with a technical glitch. The puck was using a Spanish IP address when I was in DE. Triggered my security software with my bank. Austin remotely reset the device, problem solved. Quick turn around with tech support if you need it. I got a regular USB C charger that tops off the battery in 2 or 3 hours.

I'm completing a cross country European tour this Friday. 1900 mile road trip. No glitches from cell tower to cell tower or crossing borders. "The puck is tough!"

My sister's friend borrowed the puck for a trip to Thailand. No issues either.

I cut the cord with cable TV. I'm considering cutting the cell service and using Skyroam exclusively with my cell in airplane mode using wifi. It'll work for my home wifi TV's at home.

I think the biggest advantage to Skyroam over activating your cell phone overseas is that you can have 5 devices on hotspot versus just one using my cell. This worked great for traveling with a small group.

I've had 3 of my close friends buy Solis after using my hotspot. It just works so well.

product_name: Simo Solis Lite Mobile Wi-Fi Hotspot (HS610000)
comment:
My Solis Lite has not been able to connect to a signal once. That is not an exaggeration. I feel like I was tricked. I bought this device for working while I travel around the globe. I bought it as a backup in case my hotel wifi goes out or I want to work at a cafe for the day. That way, I could still get my work done.

This bad review can be broken into 2 parts. 1) the device does has not worked once for me. 2) customer support said the device would work in the countries I needed it to work in.

Before I purchased, I contacted the support team to see if the Solis Lite works in the countries I would be visiting. The support team confirmed the device worked well in those countries. My trip consisted of visiting Nepal and Albania.

Unfortunately, the device does not come close to living up to the marketing on the website. The website claims that the "Solis Lite is the perfect hub for any on-the-go lifestyle. You can stay online anywhere to navigate your journey or share moments anytime."

While the places I am visiting are not the most popular places in the world, the Solis Lite website claims that their device works in those countries and their customer support confirmed that to me pre-purchase. I am not sure where their device works in the country because I've tried using it in 5 different cities all around the country. The only place I haven't tried using it is in the capital, which I am not planning on visiting.

When I have contacted customer support, they claim that the area I am visiting is "very rural" and that is why I am not getting a signal, even though I am traveling through decent sized cities.

I would not recommend buying this device based on my experience. Maybe it works in the United States or major European capitals.

product_name: Simo Solis Lite Mobile Wi-Fi Hotspot (HS610000)
comment:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I hate this thing so much.

I purchased this for a road trip from Arizona to my home in Alaska in my campervan. I work remotely and needed an internet solution for my time in Canada. I only get 5gb of Data in Canada with my cellular plan and I was looking for a good solution for work.

I purchased this because it offers a North America Data plan and supposedly runs off of all major carrier cell towers, so in theory, if there is cell service on a cellular provider, I should also have internet. I don't and it is garbage.

I can have full bars of LTE on my phone and somehow, my stupid orange puck can't seem to find any internet. Additionally, if there is internet it can say I have full bars on the Solis app but it cuts out severely on every single TEAMS call I have during the day and I constantly get "reconnecting" errors. I am sitting in the middle of town when this happens. There is cellular service. 

I'm pretty sure Solis gets the worst, lowest level, leftover data blocks from the carriers. At nearly $100 for 50 gigs of internet, it ought to work well. 

 I hate this stupid thing. It doesn't work. Don't buy it. It is a glorified paperweight.

product_name: Simo Solis Lite Mobile Wi-Fi Hotspot (HS610000)
comment:
I bought one of these for a recent trip to Portland where I was at a house with no internet. I chose the Solis Lite because it was cheaper than enrolling in unlimited internet from Verizon and I thought it might come in handy when I travel internationally.

Unfortunately, there are only two plans I could use with this device, a daily plan that is about $5 and an almost $50 monthly plan that limits you to 20 GB at the higher speed until it slows down to 3G during the month. I used up that 20GB in the first few days, and frankly, the "high speed" was pretty darn slow, which I thought was weird in a large city that should have plenty of access to high speed sources. There's was no way to purchase faster speed after the 20GB was used, so I ended up having internet that was super slow. Mostly, I had to use my Verizon internet on my iPhone that wasn't part of this WiFi system. Another problem was that the Solis seemed to disconnect a lot. My MacBook was constantly looking for the WiFi, because it the Wi-Fi hotspot was not consistently there.

I still have yet to test it internationally and I'm crossing my fingers that it will work; but if I had my choice again, I would not buy this device.

product_name: Simo Solis Lite Mobile Wi-Fi Hotspot (HS610000)
comment: I live in the country and thought this would be a worthy replacement for my horribly unreliable satellite internet, but I was wrong. It works ok for working from home and streaming movies (yay!) but because of cell carriers’ “fair use policies,” it’s unable to process large downloads, and I was unable to connect my gaming consoles to the hotspot. This is not mentioned anywhere on Skyroam’s website, and I had to contact customer support three times before I could get an answer about it, and even then their response was “it seems like it won’t work,” which isn’t exactly definitive... Their “solution” was to recommend that I pay for their pay-as-you-go plan, which offers full speed downloads at a rate of $6 per gigabyte. That’s just outrageously unrealistic if I’m downloading large files. I fully understand the limitations at play here, but some more transparency upfront would have been much-appreciated before I spent the money on this device and an extra $99 on the “unlimited” data plan. (Please note that because this device is pre-packaged with a free GB of data, you’ll either have to use the full 1GB or contact customer support to in-bundle it if you want to switch to the unlimited plan).

product_name: Simo Solis Lite Mobile Wi-Fi Hotspot (HS610000)
comment: Superb device and service, setup and operation is fairly easy. Used it in the US and multiple locations in the Philippines. High speed data runs out quickly and is expensive to add-on, but when functionality is more important than cost, I cannot complain.

product_name: Simo Solis Lite Mobile Wi-Fi Hotspot (HS610000)
comment: So far, so good.   bought this device to use while traveling to assure wifi access.   It has been easy to set up, and works fine used locally.   Perhaps should wait for more challenging use.  It's reassuring to know I have Geek Squad to assist if needed.

product_name: Simo Solis Lite Mobile Wi-Fi Hotspot (HS610000)
comment: Skyroam device (Solis Lite) works where our Verizon data plan won't. The ability to use all major networks through Skyroam is a wonderful asset. This feature keeps us in touch while full time RVing , allowing us to e-mail, stream videos and use internet.

product_name: Simo Solis Lite Mobile Wi-Fi Hotspot (HS610000)
comment: This is supposed to be a global hotspot. It’s not! It will only work if they have a partner network in the area. Rural areas, forget it. We were even right next to an interstate and it wouldn’t work. However, driving from coast to coast, it worked great.

product_name: Simo Solis Lite Mobile Wi-Fi Hotspot (HS610000)
comment: I have found my Solis Lite Hotspot to be a lifesaver. I had internet issues in my home and was using it when the internet was down. I also recently used it in my car on a trip to the Colorado Rockies with no issues. It has great speed and reliability!

product_name: Simo Solis Lite Mobile Wi-Fi Hotspot (HS610000)
comment: Solis is a great option for people that need fast reliable service. I’ve used it for work travel and cannot be happier with connection availability and speed. The ease of increasing data through purchasing passes is great. Definitely recommend.

product_name: Simo Solis Lite Mobile Wi-Fi Hotspot (HS610000)
comment: Handy little device. Sometimes worked great connection wise, other times could not connect and it sat in same spot in home.  Doesn’t take long to eat 1 gig of data, so when using it for tele-health meetings, it became quite expensive to use.

product_name: Simo Solis Lite Mobile Wi-Fi Hotspot (HS610000)
comment: Speed was acceptable and connection good. The only negative I had was that I purchased the Global Pay-Per-GB plan and although I only did email and web browsing and didn’t do any video streaming or downloading it used up the GBs pretty fast.

product_name: Simo Solis Lite Mobile Wi-Fi Hotspot (HS610000)
comment:
Don't waste your cash.  Your cell phone hotspot is way better and a lot less expensive.

The only valuable thing about this is that I now have a bright orange paperweight.  But I don't like the color orange.  So...

Yeah.  Pass this one up.

product_name: Simo Solis Lite Mobile Wi-Fi Hotspot (HS610000)
comment: I’m a nomad and have used multiple hot spots. This one is definitely the worst. The app is crap. It rarely loads and once it does, service information won’t change until you force quit and restart it. Which is extremely annoying. The service itself is mediocre at best and too expensive for what they deliver. It gets service maybe a quarter of the time I have service on my phone and calling it high speed is laughable. Even when the app says I have full bars of service, it takes a few minutes to load a webpage and definitely doesn’t work for video calls or mail etching any type of video. I hoped at first it was just based off my first country of use but I’ve found this to be true through multiple countries including the US, Canada, Iceland, England, Scotland, Greece and Italy. Their customer service is pretty quick though, which would be great if it was a fixable problem and not just a crappy product. I would definitely say if you have any actual need for reliable, high speed internet that Solis is not the way to go and is definitely disappointing.

product_name: Simo Solis Lite Mobile Wi-Fi Hotspot (HS610000)
comment: I loe my hotspot. I loved my old one too. The reason I bought a new one was, the old one stopped connecting. I guess it used the old technology. I just hope I get longer use out of this one. My first hotspot was only useful for 14 months.

product_name: Simo Solis Lite Mobile Wi-Fi Hotspot (HS610000)
comment: The device, once it’s up and running, works great. The speeds were good and reliable. However, it took a long time for it to connect and sometimes required multiple attempts of restarting and trying to connect before it actually would.

product_name: Simo Solis Lite Mobile Wi-Fi Hotspot (HS610000)
comment: Has worked very good for me. Your location will determine the speed you get. For the most part I can work fine from anywhere if I’m not downloading files. There’s some locations were speed is phenomenal. Love that I can pay as you go.

product_name: Simo Solis Lite Mobile Wi-Fi Hotspot (HS610000)
comment: needed to replace my old solis, which was a bit of a hassle. However, the new one was very easy to set up and although i only have used it a couple of times it has been flawless. I do like the fact that more devices can connect to it.

product_name: Simo Solis Lite Mobile Wi-Fi Hotspot (HS610000)
comment: Slow speed, eats up a TON of data just browsing web, and NO ability to stream video. Marginally better or same as using my cell phone data and much more expensive. Very disappointing since I plan to work from the road a lot this fall.

product_name: Simo Solis Lite Mobile Wi-Fi Hotspot (HS610000)
comment: I thought this product would be useful for home use, and it’s not! The gigs run out so fast and are expensive to reload there is no option of monthly WiFi payments on the app. The app is actually not helpful only for battery life.

product_name: Simo Solis Lite Mobile Wi-Fi Hotspot (HS610000)
comment: I appreciate the no contract for data that this hotspot affords the user.  I have used this all over the country and only had one issue with connectivity, which was in downtown Fort Worth, Texas.  It was simple to connect and use.

product_name: Simo Solis Lite Mobile Wi-Fi Hotspot (HS610000)
comment: I purchased a Solis 3G LTE five years ago. It has been incredible and it never disappointed me when I needed a network connection. The new Solis Lite is even better. It is brilliantly designed, easy to use, and fast to connect.

product_name: Simo Solis Lite Mobile Wi-Fi Hotspot (HS610000)
comment: Really wanted this to be great, but will have to settle for OKAY. Madrid airport is a dead zone and spent more time on chat with SOLIS then being connected. When it worked, it was great and since I own it, I will use it again.

product_name: Simo Solis Lite Mobile Wi-Fi Hotspot (HS610000)

product_name: Simo Solis Lite Mobile Wi-Fi Hotspot (HS610000)

product_name: Simo Solis Lite Mobile Wi-Fi Hotspot (HS610000)
comment: I can't say enough positive things about Skyroam: - Outstanding customer service - Came with excellent directions & was very easy to use - Worked 100% of the time on 3 devices I will never travel abroad without it!!!

product_name: Simo Solis Lite Mobile Wi-Fi Hotspot (HS610000)
comment: We purchased it for use when traveling in Europe. It has not let us down so far. Easy to use and more economical than purchasing international day pass from our mobile provider. We have recommended to family already.

product_name: Simo Solis Lite Mobile Wi-Fi Hotspot (HS610000)
comment:
I travel quite a bit and I’m tired of having to buy a separate SIM card and have my phone unlocked every time I switch phones so I settled for skyroam.

The device is not perfect and the quality is not the most durable, however it also depends how an individual handles their electronic gadgets. The reason I gave it a 5 is because based on the service they gave me I believe they’ll keep improving.

I’ve recently just got back from my two week road trip from FR through Switzerland and IT. The device worked for me for the most part. Stopped working for brief periods in situations like changing borders, changing signals. I’ve also noticed when you plug it in to charge sometimes the signal drops.

I like that it shows on the app whether you’re on a 4G or 3G network. Works perfect for keeping google maps updated through out the long drives and Spotify playing at the same time.

With that said, could use updates on the firmware for faster load up and Avoid unnecessary signal drops.

product_name: Simo Solis Lite Mobile Wi-Fi Hotspot (HS610000)
comment:
I've had great luck with my Skyroam, and have shared it with friends and family during my travels throughout the world.

Very rarely have there been any tech issues --- and I love the newest version, the Solis.

I have recommended the device to many others who travel and don't hesitate to do so now again.

product_name: Simo Solis Lite Mobile Wi-Fi Hotspot (HS610000)
comment: I have had a Solis hotspot for several years and just upgraded to the latest device. It works well at the few places I have needed it, and much safer than using an open internet. product_name: Simo Solis Lite Mobile Wi-Fi Hotspot (HS610000)

product_name: Simo Solis Lite Mobile Wi-Fi Hotspot (HS610000)
comment: I feel a little bit bad about this review. I actually haven't gotten to use it yet! I got it for a place that had bad wifi and of course this time it was good! BUT the customer service is AMAZNING!

product_name: Simo Solis Lite Mobile Wi-Fi Hotspot (HS610000)
comment: The device boots quickly, most of the time, and the internet coverage has been solid. It’s a nice upgrade from the previous Solis I’ve owned for years. The whole experience is one I would highly recommend for anyone who needs internet around the world. Great product and a great service.

product_name: Simo Solis Lite Mobile Wi-Fi Hotspot (HS610000)
comment: I bought the SkyRoam to make sure I could stay connected on the go through travels. It’s a great little device that does exactly what I need it to do - easy to use, fast, reliable! When I had a question, customer service was very responsive and resolved the issue quickly - thanks Jeff!

product_name: Simo Solis Lite Mobile Wi-Fi Hotspot (HS610000)

product_name: Simo Solis Lite Mobile Wi-Fi Hotspot (HS610000)

product_name: Simo Solis Lite Mobile Wi-Fi Hotspot (HS610000)
comment:

product_name: Simo Solis Lite Mobile Wi-Fi Hotspot (HS610000)

product_name: Simo Solis Lite Mobile Wi-Fi Hotspot (HS610000)

comment: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fantastic product, incredibly easy to set up and has flexible data plans. Never had any issue with speed either as it connects to whatever network has the best signal for your location.

comment:

It’s not expensive. It works great. Nothing to do but be sure to buy a special adapter to plug into the wall. You have to have one handle 5 V at 2 A. Most on most chargers only handle milliamps. But I found the correct ones on amazon.

product_name: Simo Solis Lite Mobile Wi-Fi Hotspot (HS610000)
comment: Works very well once it finds a cellular connection.   Simple to set up.  One upgrade would be to provide more data...20GB actually goes fairly fast and a little expensive at $50 a month.  Would rather the unlimited $50 a month plan actually gave you unlimited 4G.

product_name: Simo Solis Lite Mobile Wi-Fi Hotspot (HS610000)
