product_name: DJI Osmo Mobile 6 Smartphone 3-Axis Gimbal Stabilizer - Grey
comment:
The bad:
1. The app isn't on the play store I would assume because it doesn't meet Google's guidelines.  You need to change phone settings to allow this install.
2. It only supports the 1x and 3x cameras on the Galaxy S22 Ultra.  Why have a zoom wheel if it can't even access the 10x optical camera?  Also, the 0.6X camera is a no go.
3. Active track has trouble starting using the hand signal when the background is busy.
4. Camera and Video functionality is very limited in the mimo app.  No HDR, only 30fps support, no geotagging photos, no pro camera etc..   If you switch to the default phone camera app you cant even use the start/stop button on the gimbal, there is 0 connectivity there. 
5. The ability to look down is very limited. Placing this on a table using its mini stand you cannot look down very far.
6. Active track only works on the 1x lens.  As soon as you hit 3x it stops zooming while active track is on.  

The Good:
1. It is light, quick to setup and not much of a learning curve.
2. It fits the large S22 Ultra in a thin case and motors can handle it. 
3. Active track when working is great.  
4. Gimbal serves the purpose of making video smooth.
5. Price isn't bad compared to other DJI gimbals.

I could get over almost all the negatives if they could get all the cameras supported on this popular phone and if active track could work across each camera.  

Photo is GoPro in the Volta Handle next to the Insta360 X3, next to this OM6 Gimbal, next to the Ronin SC Gimbal with a APS-C camera.

product_name: DJI Osmo Mobile 6 Smartphone 3-Axis Gimbal Stabilizer - Grey
comment:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Overall - Crazy fast feature rich gimble Loaded with Features !


This is great fun and turns your cell phone into device that shoots incredibly good video in almost any situation. A mature and feature rich software support means you can connect a phone, pop it on and just go at it in a few minutes. If you have never used a gimble before - I would recommend the built in tutorial along with YouTube tips and tricks.

As someone who owns two other older gimbles - This instantly outmoded them. The functionality offered and the reaction speed with which this works is roughly one internet year ahead of anything else I have used. It's awesome.   

Software - It just works. Install the app, pair the device and allow it permissions. The controls just work as they should on both my older android and current iPhone. First time setup was under 2 with both phones I tried. 

Real World Size and Weight - Folds to very compact. Weight = 1.01Lbs which I consider negligible if you are carrying other gear. I budget packing space in common things I "know" - I.e. this device takes the  space of one 16oz bottle of water in my day hike-bike-trip bag.

"Torture Testing" - I tried every listed feature on the website - they all worked !  
I did this as a way to familiarize myself with the controls after completing the built in tutorial as
 well as a tips and tricks on YouTube tutorial. For laughs I threaded it into a mount I have on my mountain bike bars. Trail riding is notoriously hard to shoot whereas you want some amount of jolts and bumps to make it feel more real to the viewer -  It kept up ! I then realized I could use that to grab some subject tracking shots of a buddy I was riding with. Much to my surprise I ended up some really cool footage via that technique whereas I was only trying to test out the stabilization in what I considered an impossible shooting scenario. Next, an idea struck - Subject track a far off object to the side while riding a trail - cool shots of everything whipping by. This gimble is unstoppable and vastly exceeded my expectations ! 

Pros - 
Reaction Speed is top notch !
CAN be charged/powered while in use.
Mature product software + constant software improvements. 

Cons - 
Slight learning curve - The tutorial and YouTube are your friends !
Is it waterproof ? - No.    

Overall - Love it ! I'll be handing down or recycling two other gimbles and I'll likely purchase a second one shortly.

product_name: DJI Osmo Mobile 6 Smartphone 3-Axis Gimbal Stabilizer - Grey
comment: I'm not sure how this wasn't included in any reviews, but this basically doesn't work with Android. The DJI Mimo App is not in the Play store and if you go to the DJI website to try to download it, you get a sketchy APK that is blocked by like 99% of IT administrators. Reading between the lines, there must be some serious security and/or stability concerns with this app, and it's supposed to be user friendly so APK hacking around security restrictions is not exactly the "start it up right out of the box" they advertise. The app is not extraneous either, most of the buttons don't work if you don't have the app, basically you can just pan up, down, and side-to-side. Zoom doesn't work, record doesn't work, none of the other buttons do anything. Total waste of money.

product_name: DJI Osmo Mobile 6 Smartphone 3-Axis Gimbal Stabilizer - Grey
comment: Theres a lot to loke anout the gimble. Its small and very easy to attach my phone. The magnets work well with my magsafe phone , also well with the magsafe case i have . The lronlem is the biggest reason i pirchased was for perfectly framed level shots. However i have to manually adjust the gimble 2 degrees every time to get it level. Defeats the puppse of using the magnets to quickly attach your phone  for a quick shot. Each time i have to open up the app after phone is connected and adjust 2 degrees :(

product_name: DJI Osmo Mobile 6 Smartphone 3-Axis Gimbal Stabilizer - Grey
comment: This is my first time using a gimbal and I can honestly say that the OM 6 is super easy to use. I cannot stop making videos of my family (it’s just so much fub). Occasionally my iphone 11 shows the gimbal in the frame (only when on 0.5 view) but it honestly does not bother me because this thing is so cool. I love the stitching feature for panoramic photos. I also love the LightCut app which makes editing videos a breeze. If you’re thinking about getting this, do it. You wont regret it!

product_name: DJI Osmo Mobile 6 Smartphone 3-Axis Gimbal Stabilizer - Grey
comment: I honestly love this gimbal! I’ve had other gimbals before and hardly used them because it simply took too long to balance my phone every time! Sure this gimbal has a limited range of motion… but the best gimbal is one that you use! This one, you stick the magnet on the middle of your phone, and then it takes literally 5 seconds to be completely set up and ready to go every time after that. The gimbal is also small, so it fits right in to my Fanny pack! Also like the extension

product_name: DJI Osmo Mobile 6 Smartphone 3-Axis Gimbal Stabilizer - Grey
comment:
I recently purchased the Dji Osmo mobile 6 Mobile Gimbal and I have been blown away by its performance. It has quickly become my go-to accessory when shooting video on my phone.

The gimbal is incredibly easy to use and provides smooth, stable video footage. It has helped me capture stunning footage on-the-go and has saved me countless hours of video editing in post-production.

One of the things I love about this gimbal is its compact size. It easily fits in my pocket or camera bag, making it a great tool for traveling. It also has a long battery life so I can shoot for hours without needing to recharge.

Overall, I highly recommend the Mobile Gimbal to anyone who wants to take their mobile videography to the next level. It is a must-have accessory for anyone who wants to capture stunning video footage on their phone.

product_name: DJI Osmo Mobile 6 Smartphone 3-Axis Gimbal Stabilizer - Grey
comment: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I've owned an Osmo3 for several years and wanted to upgrade to Osmos6 due to the extended reach this would give me on the stick. Other than this, I couldn't justify spending $160. So I searched online and found an extension rod for just under $20. Osmos6 uses the same software to edit and create as Osmos3, so i decided to return it. Also, Osmos3 came with a hard case while this doesn't.  The build quality on the O3 seemed sturdy and better in my hands (large hands).

product_name: DJI Osmo Mobile 6 Smartphone 3-Axis Gimbal Stabilizer - Grey
comment: I own two of these gimbals. They are excellent and have quite a few features usually found only on professional gimbals. The second one I bought had problems and refused to properly balance no matter what. Luckily I purchased a protection replacement warranty with it and ended up getting it replaced today. The replacement works perfect, just like the first one. Highly recommended. Be sure to buy the warranty though.

It made sense to try this route so as to keep the 1 usb port on my tablet free. I purchased this Microsoft Bluetooth mouse along with another name brand Bluetooth mouse that had similar reviews to the Microsoft one. They were both on sale for around the same price, but the original price of the other one was higher. I figured I would try both out and return the one I didn't like as much. I tried the Microsoft one first because I thought I would like it better based on the smaller size, 4-way scroll option, only needing 1 battery (compared to the other one needing 2), overall design, and a few other reasons. I was right. Everything worked so well, that I didn't even try out the other mouse. The Microsoft mouse is lightweight but doesn't seem "cheap" to me. It responds perfectly and linked up flawlessly with the Bluetooth settings on my tablet. It also comes with a much longer warranty (either 3 or 4 years, but I can't remember) than the other brand, which only had 1 year. Great price. Great product. Hope this helps. Thanks. Matthew 7:12

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: The biggest issue is with the small size which gives no rest for pinky, and I do not have big hand. The texture is a bit rubbery which provides a bit of grip, and the click feels satisfying. Bluetooth connection is reliable and wake up from sleep in reasonable amount of time.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: Although I like the feel of this mouse, the Bluetooth connection is not very dependable. I've had to use the keyboard quite a lot to reconnect it, even if the mouse is on and I've walked away for a little while. I didn't expect these kind of issues with Microsoft products.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: This bluetooth mouse works great and is easy to pair. It’s not a gaming mouse but is good for work and travel uses. I like the Bluetooth connection as it saves me from using a usb slot for jump drives, cables etc. the price is very good and it comes in a variety of colors

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: I bought this to replace the OEM mouse and a non-Bluetooth wireless mouse on my iMac. It took less than a minute to connect it to the computer and it works fine. I only wish it had an on/off switch so I can turn it off when I am not going to be using it for a few days.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment:
I bought this mouse for office use since I'm constantly coming from and going to meetings.

It's easy to set up and use, and has a perfect balance of having enough heft but not feeling cumbersome.

Highly recommended if you're just needing good bang for your buck.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: The mouse is erratic and hard to point with any accuracy at times. I have reloaded drivers and found many articles online to help remediate or improve the issue. None have worked so far, have tried settings in control panel and device manager with no improvements.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: This Microsoft Bluetooth Mobile Mouse enables me freedom from wires and allows me extra room for using my laptop. I highly recommend this mouse for its mobility and wireless capabilities. The price is affordable and this is my second purchase for my second laptop.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: This mouse works well with my mac mini with bluetooth. Compact but precise. Also, it's much better than some other brands from connection perspective. Previously I had a cheap BT mouse but it disconnected from Mac occasionally but this MS one is always connected.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: I hate using the little track pad on my Microsoft Surface, so decided a mouse was in order. Since it only has one USB port, it would have to be a Bluetooth mouse. Investigated my options....and their prices...and decided this was a great choice and a good value.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment:
The mouse worked well for six weeks and suddenly stopped working.
It's not a Bluetooth connection issue or a battery issue. The blue charge light glows beautifully and it is Bluetooth connected. It was great as long as it worked but not great now. Does not work.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: When I need a new mouse, I look around but still always end up with a Microsoft. This is well built and feels comfortable even after hours of use. Bluetooth means no USB dongle taking up a port. No extra fancy buttons like some mice. Just left, right and wheel.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: This mouse has a fantastic size. A great feature is a button to put it to sleep when not in use to save the battery life. Sometimes the button has to be pressed multiple times to be awaken so I took one start off. In overall a great product. Well recommended.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: This is a perfect choice if you need a small mouse. It’s Bluetooth connection is great if your laptop is like mine and only has one USB port and need it free for your USB memory storage. It works great and the side to side scroll is actually extreme useful!

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: The Microsoft - Bluetooth Mobile Mouse 3600 - Black was easy to connect via Bluetooth to my Lenovo Yoga.  However, I do not like the fact that the wheel cannot continuously roll with a simple push or pull.  the click and move the mouse approach is terrible.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment:
This mouse is good when it works! I had problems connecting this
mouse to Lenovo & Macbook. Also you can't have 2 of them out
at the same time because they interfere with each other. I got them
working on my Dell & Asus Laptops. Logitech mice work better!

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment:
I bought this Bluetooth mouse for use with my Mac Book Air. It performs as intended, i.e., flawlessly. As a point of curiosity, I should mention that for some reason, it fails to connect to my iMac. Strange. No impact on my review, however, since it was purchased for the Air.
Wish list: it would be nice if it turned off after a period of inactivity. As is, it must be turned on and off manually, and it's easy to forget to turn it off.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment:
Very nicely constructed "laptop-sized" mouse with standard buttons, including an extra within the scroll wheel.
Pairs very easily with the computer in Bluetooth mode, and the tracking is excellent on all surfaces that I tried, including glass.

It uses a single AA battery which is easily accessible by an easily removable tab on the under-surface. Nearby, there is a small on/off button which activates a blue light, which will blink when put into bluetooth discover mode by simply holding down the "on" button for a short period. Once paired, the light glows continuously.
Unfortunately, there is no illumination on the upper surface of the mouse to show that it is "on", so, it's easy to forget to turn it off; however, in the rest mode, fortunately little current is consumed so that failure to turn it off will impact relatively minimally on battery life.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: I have been using the MS Bluetooth Mouse 3600 for about a month now and really liking it. The interface is truly Bluetooth in the sense it doesn't require you to plug in a dongle to use the mouth, and thus frees up a USB port, which is a real plus. Pairing the device to your computer is very easy (assuming you use Windows 8.1 and up) and the connectivity is pretty good. Haven't faced any issue so far and really glad I bought it.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: Most of the time, the mouse works beautifully. It is smooth and truly enjoyable to use after fighting with a couple of Logitechs that work well with my HP laptop, but very inconsistent and jumpy. The only issue I have had with this (thus the 4 stars) is that is occasionally losses contact with my PC, and the only way to reconnect seems to be restarting the computer. That can be a real pain in the caboose. Otherwise, I love it.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: Mouse fits perfectly in the palm of my bigger than average hand, not too small, not too big - good travel size. Good bluetooth connectivity on a pc. However on a Macintosh, bluetooth cannot get the link back when waking up from sleep, turning on/off mouse is not enough half the time, have to set up the link from scratch again. I'm going back to Logitech for Macintosh. Still, works great for my Windows based machines.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: I Bought this mouse along with my Surface Pro 4 as the tablet has 1 usb port so a bluetooth mouse frees up that port.  the mouse works great initially but scrolling is another issue. pages keep scrolling and moves in different directions when scrolling. ( reversed scrolling was not activated in settings) The scrolling is very problematic, its not smooth and does not translate to the exact movement of your finger.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment:
Originally bought this for wife's laptop, a Lenovo ideapad. We could not make it link up. I then paired it with my Lenovo thinkpad successfully. 
I think the problem was that her laptop was originally windows 7 upgraded to 10, while my laptop was windows 10 to start with. The mouse has quick response and has an off button; to pair, hold button for 3 seconds then look for blinking light; battery life excellent.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment:
I sort of bought this blind but I will admit it does what I need it to do. I am not a fan of it not having an on and off switch either but I have yet to use it once and it did not do what I needed it to do. It's smaller than I would like and sometimes i feel my hand cramp up but that could be due to the position of my hand than the mouse per say.
All in all it works right the first time and keeps on working.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: It's very small and lightweight and was an affordable choice. It tracks well on a wide range or surfaces and has solid battery life (so long as you remember to turn it off). It doesnt have a back button, which is a feature I miss. I also have to be careful when placing it into a case or bag so that the on button doesnt get accidentally depressed as it isnt a physical switch like in previous models ive owned.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment:
This mouse works great over Bluetooth on my Dell XPS 13 with Windows 10.

This mouse is a little small, but can be used for long periods of time. I chose this over the Microsoft Sculpt mouse because this design seems more ergonomic when in non-traditional locations like a recliner.

My connection has been stable, and I have not encountered any cursor delay.

The "BlueTrack" technology let this mouse work well on all the surfaces I've used.

There are no extra buttons, such as a back button. You may want to look elsewhere if this is important to you.

Build quality seems good, and there doesn't appear to be any exterior materials that'll wear out.

I replaced a Microsoft Wireless Mobile Mouse 4000 with this model. It is roughly the same size, and it is nice to not have a USB transmitter.

I'd highly recommend this mouse, unless you want extra buttons or a larger size.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: I specifically purchased this mouse because it's Bluetooth and used different laser technology with the mouse. I didn't want to plug another device into my USB ports on my laptop cause they come at a premium. I also didn't want to use a conventional red laser mouse as they tend not to work on different surfaces. This mouse fit the bill for both and was reasonably priced. I am very happy with this mouse.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: Purchased for use with a laptop that needed a bluetooth mouse. This is a compact mouse and paired quickly. No delay after sitting idle for brief periods (something that really annoyed me years ago with my first experience with a bluetooth mouse). Only complaint is that the wheel is very grainy when you scroll, and the wheel itself is very textured. Other than that, it seems like a quality product.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: Mouse is exactly what i was looking. Doesnt connect if i turn on the mouse before my mac book pro. If i turn on after login in, it syncs fine. Reason i didnt give it a 5 star rating is because if you are using 2.4ghz wifi it will interfer with the mouse and cause it to skip and freeze up accross your screen. To resolve this you have to be hardwired to your router or us 5.0ghz wifi on your computer

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment:
This mouse uses Blue Track (sp?) technology and it works very well on all kinds of surfaces: fabric furniture cushion; polyester (fluffy) blanket; formica table top.  The size is right for my hand and it's more comfortable than other mice I've used.  

I like this bluetooth mouse over wasting a USB port for a USB dongle wireless mouse. 

If I ever need a new mouse, I'd get another one of these.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: This is a great wireless mouse for a travel laptop. I've never had a Microsoft mouse before but I love it. I purchased it because it is bluetooth and connects directly to the built-in bluetooth in my laptop so that way I don't have the nano receiver using up one of my USB ports like most other wireless mice. BlueTrack doesn't seem to do much better than an average mouse but I'm fine with that.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: This is actually my first bluetooth mouse, believe it or not.  It's comfortable in the hand and smooth. The only problem I've experience with it is that from time to time it seems to "go to sleep" and doesn't respond right away. If I move it around for a couple of seconds it wakes up again quickly and works fine. That's the only drawback I've experienced with it. I would recommend it.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment:
Laptop has bluetooth, I didn't want to mess with losing a dongle and I needed a mouse for my kids to use.

I had no problems with pairing and the mouse appears to work fine. It's on the small side which is perfect for my children and wife (she has smaller hands), but I don't feel that it's uncomfortable for me to use (but in fairness I haven't used it extensively for long periods).

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: I purchased this Bluetooth mouse for the first time. What seemed like a very simple pairing became a very challenging task. Being not that techy, it took me one hour to pair it to my Dell laptop. Once paired, I started scratching my head again because the mouse is still asleep. I browsed for answers online, paired & unpaired, and browse YouTube. After another long hour, I finally found a sensible suggestion on YouTube.  I almost gave up and was considering throwing this mouse into the valley of the cats.  Now it's awake and working hard. On my 2nd day of use, I panicked because it seemed this mouse is asleep again when I turned on my laptop.  After some guessing game, I was able to determined that you have to turn on the mouse first before turning on your laptop so it gets to connect to each other.  If you don't want this kind of panic every time you use this mouse & turn on your laptop.  Don't buy this

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: Bluetooth mouse works with my Mac laptop, which doesn't have standard USB ports.  It's pretty small.  My biggest complaint is the middle scroll roller/button -- it seems like it's not scrolling at all, then suddenly it will scroll like crazy and pass up the spot I want on the page.  It has a side-scrolling mechanism, but it doesn't work very well because there's no fine control.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: I have owned a couple Blue Tooth mouses before and this one is the best by far. Previous ones that I have owned have always lagged in their response time when I have moved them but this mouse is as fast as any mouse I have owned including a USB and a USB with a cord. The great thing about the Blue Tooth is it does not use one of your USB ports. I highly recommend this product.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: This Bluetooth Mouse makes the perfect pair with newer, light laptops and tablets. Microsoft is also very reliable when it comes to mouses. The only tricky part is synchronizing Windows 10 and the device for the first time. Make sure you have all updates for windows and drivers installed and then try it. After that, you have more precision, good reach and a free USB socket.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment:
I use this Microsoft Bluetooth Mobile Mouse 3600 as my main mouse for my laptop. It is comfortable in my hands and the battery I put in lasts a long time. FYI, the AA battery I use is either an alkaline or rechargeable. Pairing is quick and only had to do it once. Right and left buttons and middle scroll wheel function well.

No challenges with this mouse. Love it!

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: This is a great Bluetooth mouse. It is compact and portable. It fits well in the hand and is easy to throw in your laptop bag. It is well domed for ease of use. Only criticism is because it is so short you will find the back of your hand resting on the surface rather than on the mouse. The Microsoft Sculpt Bluetooth mouse is longer if that is an issue for you.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: I purchased this mouse to replace a another Microsoft bluetooth mouse that was having trouble staying connected. I wanted to use it on a Win 7 64bit machine. The drivers for this mouse do not support Win 7, but it does work with Win 10. I am using it with my Win 10 system and managed to get the older Microsoft Bluetooth Mouse to stay connected.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: This mouse is comfortable and versatile. I'm not sure how to compare my hands to others, but the mouse was big enough for me to hold it comfortably. It worked on most surfaces as advertised (glass table, regular wooden table.. even couch!). Long battery life. Wish there was a way to switch device connections. Other than that, no complaints.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment:
Excellent advice, as usual,' from Best Buy salesman; the 
Microsoft Bluetooth mouse was easy to install (pair) with my
two year old Dell Inspiron (also bought at Best Buy).  Best Buy
had lots of products in the store to choose from, so this purchase,
with the cheerful and helpful sales guy, made the whole thing
a really pleasant experience.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment:
this mouse is OK for general office work. However, for engineering work using SOLID Works, it is not OK. We had to revert to some old mice with tails, i.e., they are USB mice as the wireless couldn't handle all the information.

My recommendation below is qualified. I recommend the product for conventional Microsoft Office software use.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: Bought this to replace you Apple mouse that didn’t bounce just right when I dropped it. Super reliable and easy to set up. Moved it to my Dell PC notebook and as with my Mac, no issue and again it’s a team player with no issues. Would like a perhaps smaller or flat version since when I carry it in my brief case it does take up more space.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: i've been using logitech mice going back to the first optical mouse i got in 2002.  i've been using the m185 ever since i went cordless.i got a new computer that only had usb c ports so i had to get rid of my old mouse.  i couldn't find a logitech one in the shape i like without the dongle so i decided to try this.  i have no complains

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: I purchased this mouse to use with a Microsoft Surface Pro 4 and an HP Envy 360 laptop. Had no problems syncing with either computer. Very responsive and no dropping. Will not wake either computer from inactive mode, but once the computer is back up it re-connects without issue. Would recommend to any user with a Surface Pro.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: I bought this to replace another Bluetooth mouse. The first one I bought was an HP and was sometimes a little iffy as to if it would work or not. This Microsoft Bluetooth has worked easily and with no problems from the start. I prefer Bluetooth connectivity over usb wireless to keep my usb ports available for other things.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: I bought this mouse after a friend told me that theirs broke down and they upgraded to one that connected to their computer. So far, with little usage, it's still going. But having to remember to turn it off is annoying. So long as you have a good memory, you should be fine and it does make a difference using a mouse.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: I liked the product for the short time it worked. After re-installs, driver updates and countless bluetooth checks it will not work. Its frustrating to have to buy protection for something that should actually work for a decent amount of time. I wish I'd bought a mouse from Costco, the return policy makes more sense.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: Excellent product. Bought to replace my usb wireless mouse. The bluetooth worked flawlessly with Wndows 11. It was automatically recognized and worked with no issues. Usb mice have a tendency to share resources with other usb devices which can make the mouse jump around. The Bluetooth version eliminates this problem.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: a spectacular mouse.... coming from the Microsoft mouse 3500 but without transceiver... not small... not big... clicking is something from outer worlds and scrolling is not hard or soft.... scrolling both directions works perfect and smoothly... signal do not drop at all.... working perfect with my surface pro 3....

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: I love this little mouse. I use it with a MacBook Pro (I know - Microsoft + Apple) and it's awesome. It worked right out of the box (after pairing it of course) and I don't have to worry about carrying (or losing) the little USB adapter. The mouse is very responsive and feels pretty comfortable. It works perfect.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: I bought this mouse because I wanted a portable wireless mouse that didn't require me to use a wireless dongle in my Surface Pro 4's sole USB port. The bluetooth mouse paired easily with my Surface and has been working smoothly. I like the convenience of the small power button on the bottom of the mouse, as well.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: Ergonomic, solid, durable! This is the second one I bought in 3 years - older one still doing well. The clicks are solid, not hollow. The best out there for the price point. The only reason for 4 stars is that the on/off button could have been a slide instead of a press-to-turn-on button, a personal preference.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: I needed an inexpensive Bluetooth capable mouse to test with an iPad pro.  This definitely filled the bill.  This is a basic mouse - no extra buttons.  It worked perfectly and connected to our iPad pro in seconds.  If you're looking for a cheap, basic, Bluetooth mouse, I would definitely recommend this one.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: I bought Microsoft's Bluetooth mouse since my new Dell XPS laptop lacked a USB-A port.  I'm glad that I made the purchase.  Using Windows 11 to connect the mouse to my laptop was easy. The performance of the mouse has been consistent as well.  For the price I paid for the device, I think it's a great value.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment:
I've had it for two months and it works great. It has good sensitivity and is responsive. Connects quickly to my Inspiron 17 7000 series laptop. Although I've forgotten to turn it off a few times (once for 2 days) it's still using the original battery-doesn't appear to be a battery hog.

I really like it.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: This mouse has a really great feel for a compact mouse.  I love the height but it is still small enough to stuff in your bag.  The sensor works good so far on all of the surfaces that i have tried and I love the click of the wheel.  The only thing I miss is forward/back buttons, but I can live without it.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: I have had much better success with usb mice but mostly due to the device issues the mice are connected too. You cannot rule out problem will not occur with the BT feature on your device connecting to the mouse. USB always works as long as you have an open port. Go the more reliable route with USB type.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: Got this mouse to go with my new laptop, so far it works very well.The bluetooth never has a problem connecting. I like the smaller size because it is easy to pack along and it fits my hand well. Most of the full size mice are uncomfortable for me, I like this size and it has all the functions I need.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: Bought this mouse 2 days ago. A day after it kept disconnecting. I replaced the battery that came with it with a new battery and within a day it is disconnecting again. I am returning.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: This is absolutely an excellent Bluetooth mouse. I am very picky in mice and have been happy with this one. I have used the Microsoft 4000 mouse for some time, but this one feels great if not a tad better in the hand. Have not had any major issues with pairing or responsiveness at all. Very happy.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: This mouse has very stable cursor movement on my Assus Laptop in Windows 10.  It solved the problem I had with the previous mouse with the cursor moving all over the place and spending most of time trying to figure out where it was. The scrolling is also nice and stable. For my needs it is great.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: Wow, I cant believe it but this product has literally done exactly what I asked for. It moves across the screen at whatever pace I command it with blinding accuracy. I am not sure if that's more of a review of my abilities or the capabilities of the mouse. I am a professional with this on my pad.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: I'm been using this for a few weeks and it has been doing what it claims to do. Works with bluetooth easily so I'm not using a USB port on my Surface. Connection is easy. Battery life is good so far. Goes to sleep when not in use. I haven't noticed any delays like I've heard from other brands.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment:
Nice Bluetooth mouse. Small and portable. If comfort is important, you will want to purchase a full-size mouse instead of this mouse.

The mouse has a single small recessed button for on, off and Bluetooth-sync. A separate rocker-switch for on-off would have been a better design - obviously. I guess Microsoft thought it was important to save $0.01 by not have a separate switch. Read the instructions to figure out how to use this combo-button. Microsoft has probably already lost money from the confusion and complexity of a combo-button.

I'm using this mouse with a new, top-of-the-line HP notebook computer with Windows 10 and Bluetooth 4.2 LE (low energy). I have experienced no problems with connectivity.

I have the cursor sensitivity set to the fastest setting and it still feels like I need to push the mouse a little bit too far to get the cursor to move as much as I would like. Perhaps a new Microsoft mouse driver will help that. I'm currently using the default Windows 10 mouse driver.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment:
Easy to use!... Just connect Via Bluetooth and you’re good to go! Extremely responsive and smooth! The weight and feel is Excellent! And the price is spot on!..
 - Works with both Mac and PC!...

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This mouse needs upgraded. The stroll up and down does not work smoothly. It does not turn off to preserve battery life when traveling. It’s not a mouse I would recommend.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: I had no problems setting this mouse up to my computer. I love that it’s wireless because everyone knows I don’t need another usb connected to my computer. My downfall is it didn’t last long being able to move the cursor where I needed it to be. It keeps getting stuck. I’ve tried changing batteries, that wasn’t the problem. I’ve tried moving the mouse closer to my computer, that didn’t help. I bought a mousepad (even though when I first used it I didn’t need to) and that didn’t help. There’s nothing more irritating than when you need this mouse to work and it doesn’t. For the time now, it will do, but I will be looking for another one.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment:
I love this mouse for my office work!  It's not for gaming.

I purchased this Bluetooth mouse due to a connectivity issue stemming from my HP Spectre X360's connectivity issues with my old Logitech K317.  (The K317 - and the K360 keyboard - still work perfectly on every other device.)

This mouse has a constant, solid, dependable Bluetooth connection.  It is roughly the same size as the Logitech K317 which is itself about the right size for a normal-sized hand.  I prefer this mouse to the Logitech because it's less slippery on the sides and the scroll wheel.

I might have to buy a few of these to connect to my other machines.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: I was in the market for a wireless mouse. I needed something Bluetooth because I wasn't about to dedicate a USB port to my mouse. I really like this mouse. It works on many surfaces: my desk, my mouse pad, & my marble kitchen table. My only wish is that it would have some auto shutdown feature built in instead of a manual power down. I keep forgetting to turn it off after use!! I'm so use to a wired mouse (if I use a mouse) my battery is dying quickly!!! I'm use to not using a mouse I haven't had to make any sort of conscious effort to remember anything. But overall I really do like it and recommend it for a good cheep mouse.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: Good mouse so far.  Compact, tracks nicely, has the tilt wheel for horizontal scrolling.  Up and running quickly.  Doesn't have the extra buttons on the side that quite a few mice have, but I don't really ever use those anyway.  Wheel and buttons are a little noisier than some other mice.  Like that it's bluetooth so don't have to mess with a dongle.  Comfortable in hand.  Only uses a single AA - have yet to see if its life is consistent with product claims.  At $20, it's a bit more than the no-name bluetooth mouse I'd purchased several years ago that only recently has been losing its connection - I think I paid about $10 for that one.  Guess the extra $10 is for Bill.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment:
Pro: I picked this mouse primarily for its Bluetooth 3.0 capability. There's no need for an extra dongle. My Surface Pro 3 picked up its signal right away. So pairing was easy. Using it is pretty comfortable. I have big hands, so using a smaller than usual mouse is not easy. Which brings up to my last point...

Con: If your looking for a compact, travel mouse, this might not be for you. I still take it everywhere, but it's not compact at all.

Overall: There's really nothing I can say about it that's bad. So far, I don't have any issues. It's just a users preference when and how to use it. It's a good buy.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment:
I bought this mouse just over a month ago to go with my Lenovo laptop (with only 2 USB ports). It makes a really nice travel mouse (compact in size and no cords, connectors, or plug-ins to fool with), and it works great, in general, with very good resolution, but it doesn't work on glass, and sometimes it seems a little slow to respond on a non-solid surface (e.g. loose cloth). On a solid surface (like a desktop, tabletop, or tight fabric), absolutely no problems. 

P.S. Just make sure that whatever device you may want to use this mouse with is compatible with Bluetooth 4.0, the level that this mouse uses.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment:
Something went wrong with my USB port and my wired mouse quit working. I knew I had Bluetooth connection on my laptop so decided to go with this unit. Paired easily, works perfectly. The software you can download for it adds some nice features too. 

 I would really like to have availability of a more complete manual (sorry, I’m a little bit of a control freak I like to know what I can do with my units). What comes with the unit is just a brochure showing you how to set it up, not even how to put in the battery. Online is no better as there is absolutely nothing about this particular model.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment:
I really like the look and feel of this Bluetooth mouse. It is compact enough to carry with me, and it is large enough to give me a good stable mouse experience. I would like however, to have a back and forward browse buttons as other Microsoft mice.

Battery life seems to be very good and the status light is helpful to know where the batter is in terms of duration. The on/off button is a little tricky, need to hold for a long time to bypass the pairing stage (especially once it has been paired already). Other than that, the traction and mouse performance is very accurate.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: This mouse is great and comnects easily to laptop, samsung tab, etc without usb. I bought it online and spent about $14.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: Smooth. Small. It is a mouse. Has a left and right scroll feature thats handy every now and then.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: I bought this microsoft bluetooth mouse after having first purchased a Logitech bluetooth mouse (one for travel, one for home). I use both with my Macbook. I have found that the Microsoft version is not as easy to manipulate as the Logitech version, doesn't roll as well, and because the on/off button is a press-down button, it is hard to tell when the mouse is off, as compared to the Logitech on/off switch. The Microsoft version is also heavier and more mounded, so it is not as comfortable in my small hand. I would not buy the Microsoft mouse again.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: The Microsoft mouse simply doesnt work on most surfaces. Not on any of my tables or desks unless I press hard on a file folder on my desk. In contrast, I have been through 4 Logitech wireless mice with USB dongles and the Logitech mouse works on my couch, my knee, and any table. I will never buy another Microsoft product. I had one of the first "Surface Pro's" and it just stop turning on most of the time. When I took it in aftr 2 yrs I was told "Yeah, those first generation Surface Pro's did that. You should be able to get $50 for the cord though.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: I like the feel of this mouse, and it responds quite well; the wheel is somewhat sluggish, though, but is tolerable.  The big problem I have with this item is that I have to reset the bluetooth connection frequently (often several times a day), as the mouse continually disconnects randomly from the bluetooth.  The only way I've found to get it going again is to turn off the bluetooth on the computer then turn it back on and let the mouse reconnect.  Needless to say, this really doesn't work for me.  I'll have to buy another kind of mouse.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: As an individual who has no actual office space, I really like this mouse. I constantly am moving from home to the shop, coffee shops and whatnot, and this mouse fits nicely in my bag with my laptop and charger. I've used it on uneven surfaces, and as long as I have my mouse pad, have had no problems.  I like not having a cord or wifi usb bit to worry about while taking my laptop around everywhere, also less pieces to loose along the way.  The click is soft and so is the scroll, which I find is a nice perk, feels like better quality. Has good control and moves smoothly.  I gave this mouse 4/5 because it's on the small side, which is perfect for small lady hands, but I could see being an issue for men with larger hands who are looking to buy this product.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: When I saw this product I thought great, I can save a USB port. I installed it on a 2016 Thinkpad Yoga and a 2017 Thinkpad E570, both running Windows 10. It failed miserably on both systems, never running for more than 10 minutes without a crash. Wasted two hours consulting various sites to troubleshoot. Having thrown away the packaging (whoever would think a mouse can fail?) I couldn't return it. Now it's in the garbage can where it belongs.  I'm sorry, but this is 2017, the mouse has to work. Stay away.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment:
This is one of only a few truly Bluetooth mouse I've come across, and I really like it! It fits nicely in my small hand and the sides are of a nice material that lets you comfortably rest your thumb (and pinkie, if you're like me) against them without being slippery. I really like that it has a power switch, too, because I don't leaving things on when I'm not using them, so I can turn the mouse off overnight or if I'm not using my laptop for prolong times.

The mouse is perfectly symmetrical, so I think it could work just as well with predominant left hand users, so long as you can change the settings on your computer and tell it that the right button of the mouse will be the primary button (unless you don't mind using your middle finger as your primary button-clicking finger).

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: Mouse worked fine on a Windows 10 computer, but mouse movements hung several times on a Windows 7 Platform. In previous MS Bluetooth mouse versions, there was additional buttons above the thumb which really was handy for things like paging forward and back (default functions). Seems like no Bluetooth mouse has this anymore. Judging from the increasing amount of tablet-styled computers that require Bluetooth, you'd think the more modern mouse features should be included in the latest Bluetooth mouses.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: after swiping my tablet screen a million times, and needing to clean it very often, I looked for a Blue Tooth Mouse to move me along quicker. It works very well, even using a magazine to set it on instead of a mouse pad. Family laughed when I bought it, after watching the ease of using it flawlessly, they also purchased one for themselves. Just wish the red "ON" indicator was on the top and visible so you knew when to switch it off. Other than that, buy one of you can find one, they sell out quickly

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: Paired up with my MacBook Air and my MacBook Retina.   The mouse obviously sits flat as it should and the mouse buttons have a nice soft click which I love.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: This used to work fine, but a couple months in I cant use the scroll button anymore.  Skips up and down the page and make working on projects impossible.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: I am never sure this mouse will work with my new Windows 10 laptop. I’ve had to pair it repeatedly even though it is listed as a device that is “working properly”. No mouse movements. No click. Nothing. My first attempt was to delete, then re-add it. I could not add it again until I updated Windows to the latest release - 1709. After that, I successfully re-added it, only to find after shutdown then boot a day or two later, it’s not working again. So instead of deleting it, I paired it again even though I see it plainly in the device list. So now I have 3 identical MS mice connected. I am thinking of returning it and get something else. I wanted the wireless Bluetooth so I can free up a USB port. Oh, and I am on my third battery, thinking that was the problem. It worked today. Will see if it works tomorrow. :(

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: Ever since the switch from rolling ball to optical laser-controlled mice, I have purchased them from Microsoft and have never been disappointed. I write this review in part with a decade+ old wired, optical mouse. This bluetooth mobile mouse is no exception. It features easy set-up, nice laser response, a very comfortable grip, with snappy clicking, and a responsive scroll wheel. A perfect mouse to pair to a laptop with a poorly implemented touchpad.

product_name: Microsoft 3600 Bluetooth BlueTrack Mobile Mouse (PN7-00002) - Black
comment: I bought this mouse to use as a multipurpose tool for my laptop, tablet and raspberry pi. Firstly, it has no support on raspbian which is the OS for the pi. Tablet and laptop use however are ok. at first the mouse was really responsive and a great asset for AutoCAD and Solidworks (modelling programs). However after a few weeks I find the responsiveness to be spotty at times. Likely because it's Bluetooth but just keep that in mind

I have had an AliveCor monitor for over 2 years now.  It is very useful for tracking long term trends and I know it is highly accurate in detecting Afib.  In my case however, it has misdiagnosed Afib where it did not occur.  It has done this at least 3-4 times. I sent in for a paid analysis and it was confirmed the ecg was interpreted incorrectly by their programming.  I also had an issue where intermittently the device would not work at all.  This started occurring 10 months into my ownership and unfortunately I waited too long (4 more months) to inquire about the problem and was told it was out of warranty.  I was subsequently able to correct this problem short term by bending the battery connections out to make better contact with the battery, but I still have to frequently spin the battery  inside the case in order for it to work, and occasionally bend the battery contacts back out.  I don't have this problem with any other device I have that uses a coin battery.  I do have time periods where I get frequent PVC's, and the AliveCor is very helpful in putting a number on these.  All in all I'm sure it definitely works as advertised.  I'm hopeful that in the future it may also measure other arrhythmias or things such as QT intervals.

First if you have a concern about your heart racing or pounding, get off the internet, call 911 and get to your nearest hospital!!

If you are still here, then maybe you only have a mild concern. In short, Kardia is as good as the positive reviews say!! I bought it in store, installed the App and was able to use it right away. I did not pay for any extra subscriptions so I can’t say anything about those. 

I will say that my heart was periodically racing, pounding… (I did not think it was that serious.) It was mainly in the evening when the doctor’s office is closed. I looked at reviews, bought it, tried it and saw “unclassified” and “Possible Atrial Fibrillation!” I called my cardiologist and made an appointment. (I probably should’ve went to the ER, but this was early Covid time). I told the doctor about the readings, at first he said “I don’t trust those things.” After my EKG in the office he said “let me see that again.” My saved Kardia reports matched his! He explained how to read the EKG and the irregularities. I now will be taking two low dose medications for life but now my EKGs are “normal” or as they say now “normal sinus rhythm.” I’m alive 2 years later to write this review. Best life saving purchase that I have ever made!!

My cardiologist suggested getting this unit - I have bradycardia and LBBB. It's a very simple unit, and I had it glued to the back of my iPhone for several months, taking ECG readings whenever I felt "off" or dizzy. The only correlate was when my HR fell below 40. Then I got tired of the iPhone being thicker and unstuck the unit, which I now leave on my desk and use separately. Alas, having the sensor unit separate presents its own problems - when I carry it in my pocket the battery falls out! It's easy to put back in, but I worry about it. The software app has been updated since I first got it, and I can't figure out some things that were easy before, like deleting a noisy reading. The app tries to detect if you have atrial fib, but not other conditions. It thinks my LBBB traces are "Normal" unless my HR is below 50, in which case it sort of gives up. My only other question about the system is how it smooths the data - the first few seconds of readings are really noisy with a lot of baseline drift, then suddenly it smooths out. Only sometimes it overlays a much faster pulse which it eventually decides to remove. Overall, very useful. Amazing it's so small.
Amazing how this little unit works, its a great gadget to have around. And the case is really a great buy too, fits excellent

On the advice of my primary care physician (PCP), I purchased this device to be able to monitor myself for incidences of atrial fibrillation.  It could not have been easier to set up and to use.  Because my phone is 3 yrs old, before purchasing, I checked the AliveCor website to verify that my Android Samsung is compatible.  I had no difficulty downloading the App.  Getting readings of my heart rate and EKG was simple--it takes only 30 seconds.  After saving the results to my phone, I can email them to my PCP.  My cardiologist viewed the saved results at my next appointment, which was useful to confirm that I had experienced one incident of a-fib. (Note: He does not provide email access to his patients, and my EKG results cannot be uploaded to the patient portal.  He thinks it is good that I got the Kardia, but advised me to only record my EKG if I am feeling that I might be in a-fib.)   When using the Samsung Health App on my phone, I often have difficulty getting a reading of my heart rate, which is measured with a finger sensor. There is no such issue on the Kardia.  Overall, I think this is a great device to have--especially during the pandemic!

My five star rating is for the monitor itself and the concept.  I use it twice a day and it saves me from taking coumadin et. al. on the off chance that my A-fib might return.  For that alone I would give it ten stars.  However, I feel that the software could badly use some improvements:  1. The iPhone app crashes much too often when taking or deleting a reading.  This never happened until Version 3.0.2. 2.  There is no way to easily discard a reading.  You have to save it first (a 2 step process), and then go through the 3 step process to delete it.  This is far too much work.  To make matters worse, the down arrow for Edit/Delete is so small  that I miss it half the time, thus adding even more steps. 3.  The web site could be very useful for observing trends over a longer period of time (I often need to view the trends in my heart rate over several weeks).  Alas, the web site only only shows 3 days/6 readings on a page (which is largely useless)  and each reading takes up far too much room on a page.  I would love to see all readings for the current month, prior month, etc. in a nice concise format.  I hope that 2016 will see some major upgrades.

I am pleasantly surprised at how easy this device is to use. It’s also easy to send it to your doctor. I would highly recommend this product to anyone
I'm having trouble sharing data with my doctor everything seems to be password protected. It seems to me you have to pay for the monthly subscription.
This is an amazing device that my personal physician suggested to me.  I would likely have given 5 stars if I had purchased the higher priced version.
I does everything it said it would. I like that it links to the Omron 7 series blood pressure monitor and records it to your phone along with the EKG.
I bought this for my mother who suffers from afib.  She is easily able to check her heart rates and send the information to her physician for review!!
I was surprised how easy this was to set up and use.  It lost one star because the app is constantly asking me to upgrade to the subscription service.
Great product!  Three stars because it only lasted a year- this is my second one.  i bought the carrying case - will see if that makes it last longer.
Surprised as to how well this works.  The biggest thing is to have patient relax their forearms on a table or flat surface while taking a tracing.....
App works great!  Easy to use!  When it shows I'm in AFB, I usually don't feel good.  Due to medicine changes, I'm not in AFB and I am feeling great.
Amazing little device that easily produces quality EKGs acceptable to my doctor. I can save, send, and print the readouts. Couldn’t be easier to use.
This product does not work with my iPhone nor my Apple Watch. I wear a pacemaker.  I had no troubles with my older iPhone.  I have atrial fibulation.
I find the app works very well but if left active it will rundown your battery In a short time. Perhaps there should be a time out feature added to the app.
I am a Family Medicine physician and prescribe these for my patients with a-fib, SVT, arrhythmias, etc.  I use it myself to evaluate patients in the office.
I bought this for my dad a while back so that he would keep better care of his health.  he never took it out of the box.  now his pacemaker does it for him.
I thought it was a good purchase to monitor your heart rate and track any discrepancies.  The program was easy to install and very simple to use the device.
Cheap little device, with an expensive monthly subscription. Can be dangerous, false sense of security. I read go to physician if symptoms and get real ekg.
This was a good purchase for me.   I do not have to go to medical services to record my heart rate due to Sinus Tachycardia. It is small, sleek, and mobile.
My unit does not properly work with my Medtronic AICD.  it worked fine prior to installation.  I have contacted Alivecor but they do not seem to have cure.
Very easy to set up and use.  Artifact usually goes away within 30 sec to provide a clear EKG.  My Kardio mobile came with a clip.  Was not aware it would.
30 seconds and you've got a medical grade report.  You can then export them as a PDF, email them and share them with your doctor, if needed.  Very pleased!
My father’s cardiologist recommended this to him before he has surgery. It was easy to set up, easy to teach him how to do and easy to record and document.
Not Bluetooth.  Communicates with phone by sound.  Communications problems if there is any ambient sound like from TV or even if the refrigerator comes on.
Works as described. I used it with my iPhone.  Liked it because needed no special equipment and didn’t have to pay monthly fee unless I wanted monitoring.
I wish there was a free interpretation, even if only for a limited number of reads.  I am a nurse practitioner & use it for myself & other family members.
It is nice to finally have a portable EKG devise to carry with you. I have wanted one for a long time and finally AliveCor came along and made it possible
Works as advertised.  It needs to be on a hard surface, ie a tabletop or the top of a closed laptop.  This way you get a strong signal to your cell phone.
With serious issues, this item is a must have.  My doctor loves the report that it generates that I can send directly to her via email.  Highly recommend.
I do have trouble with receiving a signal sometimes. But takes a VERY accurate EKG that does aid in informing your doctor and yourself when you need help.
Very effective piece of technology, although it’s so small, the Kardia is easy to use and records your heart rhythms in seconds. It was a great purchase.
The Kardia Mobile works perfectly and the service and shipping was excellent. A family member bought my wife the carrying case and it is perfect as well.
An excellent product which was introduced to me by my cardio-electrophysiologist.  I have recommended it to several patients and other medical personnel.
Simple to set up and use.  Nice device to provide a level of confidence that in these covid vaccination fear times that our heart is performing properly.
This device helped to diagnose me with my paroxysmal atrial fibrillation when all the doctors did not believe me. Thank you. Now treated and feel better.
The KARDIA is the best. I have tried others. It alerted me to see the Dr for real. The screen is big and easy to read because it it used with your phone.
Easy to use and small enough to take most anywhere.  I have yet to run the original battery down.  My AFIB is easily monitored and shared with my doctor.
I like it but, it is a little deceiving when you buy it and then find out you have to subscribe to a paid monthly service to get the full benefit of it!
The AliveCor Mobile ECG has performed extremely well.    I utilize the device almost daily.   It is proven very valuable to pinpoint trends in my heart rhythm.
Not always has appeared to be accurate in rating heart rate as "normal" although multiple recordings " one taken right after another" appear to look identical.
It's a super portable EKG and does not require fancy watch. Is great for family, etc. where you need to get a reading and do not have a device for them to use.

Doctor recommended and it is great. Provides peace of mind and email if needed the results to doctor or store as pdf on phone fir next visit 

Highly recommend

Easy to set up and use. App is available for android.
Advises when you should discuss results with your doctor. Use in conjunction with your doctor's guidance.
Believe it will be most useful in identifying my intermittent atrial fibrillation when fly fishing in remote areas without ready access to medical facilities.
This little machine is very interesting and takes the question out of your mind if you are in A-Fib or not.  It takes no effort at all to get a quick reading.
A great device to check your heart, especially if you have a heart condition, it gives to a precise reading that you can present to your health professional!!
effective device-my only concern is battery life of the device and I needed to receive a new device in less than 1 year after purchase because of malfunction.
Great app and great service. Device now dead because it's impossible to get the little tiny screw out of the battery door to change the battery. Such a waste.
AliveCor was recommended by my cardiologist.  The nominal cost can give you peace of mind which is priceless.  I have recommended AliveCor to several friends.
Wanted to buy the latest Apple Watch so that I could check my heart rhythm on demand, but this little device was a fraction of the cost and works really well.
A fantastic tool for dealing with A-Fib!  But also a solid tool for looking at electrical activity in an emergency before a full cardiac monitor is available.
Excellent way to keep an eye on your heart between visits to the cardiologist. I have had some Afib and need to monitor it daily. This gives me peace of mind.
Bought it one day and next day I took 2 EKG’s that stated possible atrial fibrillation, so I immediately went to ER.  I was so glad I had purchased this item.

I bought a 2nd device so that I could see if the artifact I was seeing on my original device was a result of the device failing or my improper use of it.  So far, there is no conclusion I can reach.

Overall, I give the device a very good rating.  When I first showed the device to my cardiologist in May of 2015 he said it was just a toy and of no value.  Nine months later he'd turned around 180 degrees.  I don't know what happened in the mean time but he now thinks it very useful.  My GP thought it was a great device from the beginning.  All the nurses I've shown it to in cardiac rehab didn't know such a device existed and thought it was great. 
I recently required the services if an electrophysiologist.  He though the recordings I'd made before seeing him showing potential Afib/Aflutter and the recordings made post-ablation were very useful and he gave me his email address to keep him apprised of my progress.
Even though the device is not a diagnostic tool and it records just one lead,  it is so much better to have recordings that can be seen by others instead of just showing up at the ER saying, "I think something's wrong"!
This needs to be a hard case so that it can be secure in your pocket, briefcase, luggage when traveling or at work! Disappointed in the quality of this case.
How is this different than a free heart rate app on your phone that detects pulse through the camerA? Since this doesnt seem to read any electircal activity?
Good implementation of EKG on iPhone but needs better hardware interface and sound interface is disturbing to many people who can hear the high pitched sound

The transaction went smoothly from the online purchase to pick up.  It was expedited quickly and delivered to my vehicle was the same. 

Thanks to your team!
This is a peace of mind tool. We love having this on hand since my husband has afib and this is a quick way to assure all is well. Certainly worth the price.
Great investment to record real time heart rhythms for doctor to evaluate. Easy to share with physician so timely intervention and treatment can be obtained.

Nice little device that takes decent EKG's. Was able to self-diagnose an arrhythmia which was confirmed by a cardiology workup.
Now use it to monitor myself.
It is an excellent product. As a pulmonary specialist I have recommended this to others. My Internist had never seen this before.  Need to get the word out.
Excellent customer service! I like the app, I like that they provide scientific background. I'd like to see a rating of how accurate or noisy the signal is.
Great tool, quick shipment. Easy to use. Would like to see a bit more automatic analysis, but the fact that it reports on observed a-fib is most important for me.
Easy!  App is not complicated. Saving data as a PDF was great. My cardiologist staff were impressed (but doesn't replace office visits for standard 12 point EKG).
The application generates far too many "unclassified" readings.  Other than that I like the simplicity of use and when it records properly it is an excellent app.
A great little device to check my irregular heart beats that happen every once in awhile.  The device gives a nice pdf copy that I can store in my health history.
Ease of use makes this EKG monitor well worth the money! Works really well, I mentioned to my cardiologist that I was using this and she said it was a great idea!
very glad I got this it helps me keep on track with my heart's ability being I have a skip in my beat but all is good now because this device lets me know thanks
KardiaMobile eouid be a great tool except for the it emits a high pitched frequency that my young children can hear whenever I touch it to monitor my heart rate.

very difficult to set up I had to put in a credit card, than the website wouldn't take the credit card info.
I returned it, it is not as easy as it looks on tv.

Very easy to download app and use. 
When I have palpitations, it is a comfort to know if I am in atrial fibrillation or not, that being a very serious condition
This item is brand new so I haven't had much experience using the device. It is easy to use and provides easy instruction to administer the cardiovascular tests.
Thats a long time for the tracing to calm down to something significant. That is with added conduction fluid and very still arms.  Perhaps I have an older model?
Have this available has really decreased my health stress.  I would recommend that anyone with heart problems to get this product and have it handy at all times.
Nice device to have if you are experiencing episodes outside of the doctors office. It doesn’t always connect right away even with the phone sitting next to it.

I only bought this a few days ago and already I'm pleased.  I like how it works, how simple it is to use, how small it is (I've ordered a case for it so it won't be lost), and how I can see the results instantly.  I have an apple watch and this, I think adds additional peace of mind.
However, two things.  1) While the app does sync with Apple Health Kit, it doesn't sync with the blood pressure readings, that I must take several times a day.  It has space for me to add the info, but I would rather it added it itself, because it already adds the EKG readings from the apple watch, so I'm confused why it doesn't with the BP.
2) It requires a microphone, which is logical, so I have to turn off the podcasts or audible books I spend the most time listening to.  I'm ok with that.  What does bother me though, is that I also have to turn off my hearing aids(!!!) because they are bluetooth and sync to my phone.  That is actually unpleasant for me.  I know it's only for a minute, at the most, but still, it's something I hope that Kardia can eventually work around.  
Other than those two issues, I like Kardia and will keep using it.
Awesome device. Used when in afib and recorded flatline when heart rate reset to normal rhythm. Was that sued by doctor to diagnose melds and install pacemaker.
With a fib it’s good to have. Also can send it to the doctor if needed.   Hopefully we’ll get off of elequis because of this.  $300. O0  is hard to come up with
This product was recommended by my doctor and works great. I highly recommend it for anyone that wants to monitor their heart rate. Very easy to setup and use.
Alive Corps works well for the data it is designed able to capture. I just wish that it was able to give a more complete picture, like the EKG the doctor does!
I haven’t got a good readout yet.  It jumps all over the place even though I am holding perfectly still.  It keeps saying “error.”  My watch does a better job.
This is a great little gadget.  I bought it after our cardiologist recommended it.  He said it changed his practice.  It is very easy to use and very accurate.
This is a great addition to my arsenal of medical devices to keep me informed of my daily health. The ability to send my readings to my physician is priceless.
I bought my KardiaMobile on Kardia's website. I received it just two days later. Very fast delivery. The device works very well and I'm happy with my purchase.
Simple product that works great on large animals! Love the alivecor, just don’t put it through the washing machine…. This purchase was to replace a washed one!
Replacing the battery cover is impossible.  It shouldn’t be this difficult.  Would not recommend this product due to the difficulty of the battery replacement.
Worked nicely for about 12 months. Was able to use it for picking up afib and svt. However, after 1 year, the electrodes got slowly damaged and excessive noise
Works perfectly and does exactly what I wanted to do.  In addition when I showed up with a few printed EKGs that were taken with this device my cardiologist loved it.
Even with maximal sensitivity, EKG tracing still too small. Need direct interface with EHR, practice fusion. When is the AliveCor 12 lead EKG, Mac compatible, coming?
I am a cardiology nurse and all of the cardiologist I work with recommend this product. This was the perfect gift for my sister who is experiencing some rhythm issues
Disappointing process.  Requires additional fees to get complete EKG results.    I understand fees for a medical review, etc. but this is bad.  You should be ashamed.

If you have any kind of heart issues, do not hesitate in getting one of these!! 

I have the older version and this newer version. 

Do not hesitate!!! GET IT TODAY!!
AliveCor states that this is compatible with most smartphones. IT IS NOT. Only if you have a certain iPhone or Samsung will it work. 90% of smartphones will not work.
Kardia Mobile works fine, but almost everything you want to do with the device requires a service subscription. I had over a year's worth of data and it is all gone.
I purchased the Kardia Mobile for my husband since he was recently diagnosed with atrial Fib. It has been a Godsend in letting him know what is happening internally.
I like the app and have used it to record and email to my cardiologist.  The only negative is the case fits too tight on my iPhone 6 and is very difficult to remove.
I showed this device to my doctor and demonstrated it for her. She was impressed with the ease of use and stated that she will start recommending it to her patients.
Purchased for my husband.  He researched and decided that he wanted the monitor with more features so this one was returned.  He did not try this prior to returning.
Excellent product for how simple it is. Easy to use with immediate results. Low cost to help give you ease of mind or allow you to know you need medical assistance.
I bought this device a month ago after suffering from Covid. I thought I had AFIB but all of my EKG’s results are normal sinus rhythms. Reassuring to say the least.
Allows me to easily take an EKG anytime. My doctor ignored me when I first thought I had AFib, but took me seriously when I showed him the history from this device.
It miss reads a lot. My heart rate was 70 and it said 250. At a heart rate of 250 I would have been in ICU. It say Afib the doctor read the ekg and say it's normal.
What a great product, straight out of box easily took my ekg in seconds after downloading app. Great quality easy instructions. Simple format to understand results.
I feel that the Kardia Mobile keeps me informed of my intermittent AFIB. Knowing this is important. It’s ease of use, prompt reporting and small size is impressive.
I am a cardiologist and see many patients with arrhythmias including atrial fibrillation. the Alive Cor app is incredibly cost-effective for patients and physicians
It would be better if the time parameters for such things as alcohol and caffeine were stated.  Caffeine one hour ago, 10 hours ago???? Probably makes a difference.
It's great to have this little divice at home, this way I control my arrhythmia and help me to know when I really need to go to my cardiologist. I love this divice.
It really works and is very helpful big time.  Only thing is it’s very easy to mess up and you have to restart over again cause if you move even your leg it pauses.
Dryer had dent when unboxed. Delivery guys actually asked if we wanted to accept it in that condition. Why would we want to pay for a dryer that already had a dent?
Bought this for my husband.   I read the reviews prior to making the purchase.   This is very easy to use and every reliable.    Totally satisfied with the product.

THRILLED WITH THIS PURCHASE, IS THERE AMYTHING MORE IMPORTANT THAN YOUR HEALTH!  NOW I CAN BE ALERTED TO ANYTHING THAT MIGHT COMPROMISE MY HEART HEALTH.
