THANK YOU!
Terrific product. The software keeps improving enabling more and more specificity in its assessment of heart rhythm.  For peace of mind, I wouldn’t be without it.
Bought this for a known heart issue but really came into use for an unknown issue. Doctor was very impressed that we could hand him the phone and he could see that readouts!
I love how easy it is to use. It took a while to figure out all the nuisances such as sending password to doctor for unencrypting. What I don't like are all the extra costs.
Easy to use.  I rarely experience A-Fib.  I often have bigiminy without symptoms.  Kardia sometimes tags these as possible A-Fib, but it is easy to recognize the difference.
Very happy with this product, having it, adds to my peace of mind. I like how I can send my EKG to my cardiologist. It was shipped and received quickly and was a good price.
The reason I do not give this a 5 star rating is that it will not work when I have my blue-tooth enabled hearing aids in.  I have to turn them off before I can use AliveCor.
This is a great way for me to start keeping track of what my heart health is at the moment and also hopefully reduce the risk going forward not knowing if I have any issues.
this has help my doctor monitor my heart and determine if there were serious issues occurring. this is a great product and I would recommended it to anyone with heart issues
I love the results but can’t find anywhere if I MUST Remove my hearing aids FIRST as I keep getting error msgs that it cannot connect to the microphone on my I Phone 8 plus
My Dr. asked me to monitor my heart rhythms  Two unusual rhythms were detected and I will wear a zio patch for a week for continuous monitoring to help define my condition.
I have intermittent A Fib. The device lets me keep a record to show my cardiologist.  The device and the app are extremely simple to use. I'm very pleased with my purchase.
As a retired medical professional I find this to be an outstanding device. Has been very easy to use, and the information is most valuable. I highly recommend this product.
I have many patients on opiods. Testing the rate, QRS, and QT intervals are very important.  This app has been effectively saving time  in recording the information I need.
I like my KatdiaMobile. It allows me me to monitor my afib and my cardiologist trust it enough to allow me to email him the test to see if he needs to see me. That’s great.
So far so good....Set up was very simple. Instructions for use were very easy to follow. I am a nurse and what I see so far the EKG strips are very sharp and easy to read.
As an EMT-Intermediate, I can give my phone to a patient while I'm getting my 4/12 lead ready to go and have an early indication of an irregular rhythm or another problem.
nice product with readable one-lead ecg, helps follow rhythm, rate. I got since I develop 2nd degree heart block with exercise, so it is a good way to document and follow.

my husband has AFIB and has to monitor his condition.
we tried 2 other devices and this produced the best strip and has been very accurate according to to our cardiologist
After being diagnosed with Afib, I thought this would be a handy device to have with me at all times. My watch also has an afib detector but I think this is more accurate.
5 stars for the AliveCor Kardia and how it works. 1 star for the 14.99 per month fee to store your records. Very expensive for AliveCor Kardia case to protect this device.
Short learning curve.  Compatible with my existing Omron blood pressure app. Easy to email/print PDF file for each reading.  Responsive customer service even on a Sunday.
Unable to see atrial fibrillation/flutter in ecg tracing Cannot see atrial or ventricular pacing spikes in ecg tracing, even with " "enhance on" Otherwise a very good app
Great technology wonderful AP. Still not accurate 100% of the times - I have had one false positive for A Fib in the last 6 months. I hope to see continuing improvements.
I have been using Alivecor regularly in my office practice as a cardiologist.  It saves time giving me quick answers on a daily basis. Patients just love this technology!
great little item to tell if your heart is working normal.  I use everyday. IF YOU HAVE BEEN IN AFIB this item is worth every penny.    all you need is a good cell phone.
The EKG results r only 30 seconds! That really isn't enough time to determine if there is an arrhythmia problem.  I had a 48 Jr holter monitor which revealed more issues.
Having to wait 24 hours after the first recording was inconvenient, but when permitted to send the results to our own cardiologist, this has been a great monitoring tool.
I have to watch mothers heart and this tool makes it so easy to evaluate her heart rhythm. It connects via blue took to iPad and results can easily be sent to her doctor.
It took me a while to figure out. I had to call the company to troubleshoot why my iPad wouldn’t record. I finally had to clean dust out of microphone and then it worked.
The device and app were easy to set up and are just as easy to use.  This was recommended by my cardiologist and it's so much better than having to wear a heart monitor.
I have PAF and have found it helpful to document my rhythm. I have it attached to a phone case and find its hard to hold to minimize artifact. Great tool and app though.
Easy to set up and use.  Varied results.  Numerous Unclassified, Possible Afib, Normal results.  Reviewed by Cardiologist as all normal.  Not keen on algorithm analysis.
It worked for me but I bought it for my wife.  EVERY single time it shows up "unreadable".  This is exactly 1 second after it worked for me so there is not interference.
I am a Registered Nurse, I bought the product for my mother, It does not give a clear ekg tracing , alot of artifact,but it does provide a good interpretation of reading
I ordered online and picked up at store. This is a great tool for keeping up with your heart beat. Easy to set up, keep a history, and e mail your Dr. With test results.
So very happy I bought this item! It has given me real piece of mind. I've told all my friends they need to get this so they don't have to run to a doctor all the time.
I have an irregular heartbeat so I be tried the Apple Watch and Fitbit. I purchased this and it’s very accurate and easy to use. My cardiologist says it’s accurate too.
can only see a small portion of the image w/o resorting to a PDF. How can I see an image in the horizontal mode on my IPhone 5S The rotation is not locked on the phone.
Very cool device that keeps track of your EKG.  My doctor was going to put me on a 24 hour heart monitor and when he found out I had this he said this would do the job.
My only comment is that it was very difficult prying the safety case off my iPhone every day.  I really liked the app, however, and if you ever correct that let me know
Works for a week or so then no signal. Have changed battery.  Have cleaned pads but possibly not cleaning will enough. Trying to figure this out. Have restarted phone??
It does what it claims and quickly too. It allows for archiving results and sharing them with whoever you want. The only thing it cannot do is monitor when I am asleep.
My husband loves his gift. We were disappointed that it didn't get to us as soon as we expected. My husband carries this everywhere he goes. He tells everyone about it.
Accurate readings and very small size. Kinda sucks you have to pay for the monthly service to be able to generate a heart health report and such but still great to have

Easy to use, as accurate as my Garmin Fenix 5. Gives me piece of mind as I have a history of heart disease, stroke, and heart attacks 8n my family.

Highly recommended.
A very easy way to take an EKG. Easy to download app. Will be sending PDF of results to my Cardiologist who recommended this product to capture my AFIB when it occurs.
I have nothing but good comments about the Kardia Mobile:  easy to use; dependable; USEFUL for recording history to share with your Dr.; customer service is fantastic.
I lack the knowledge to read, least of it rate, ECGs. However, they're easy to record in the most different circumstances. My doctors have a high opinion of this tool.
fairly to install on cell phone or tablet.  If you want the extras you pay for it.  husband has no problem taking his. If you are concerned with your heart good value.

The good:  Small fits in a wallet, or attaches to the back of your phone.  The bad: It attaches to your phone back so coins in your pocket can run down the battery. For more than the basic reading you have to pay a subscription.  They pray on fear and try to get you to pay for consultations and advanced features.  Privacy statement says they can sell your data to other parties.  Needs to be less than 10 inches from your phone to get a good signal and connection.  Recently purchased it hoping for a better resolution and ease of use for readings.  I got an pulse rate warning from my watch, used the watch EKG and it showed Afib detected, I tried the Kardia, nope, you're fine.  Checked my watch EKG again, it still showed Afib.  Tried an older Omron monitor I have, it showed Afib.  Tried the Kardia again, nope, normal sine.  I have had this happen on two different occasions several days apart. The closest it came to any abnormal reading was unclassified.   If I have symptoms and it shows on 2 other devices, but not this one, then it's a piece of crap that I don't want.  Taking it back.  I would not recommend it to anyone.
I have a history of atrial flutter.   When I notice something going on with my heart, I use this incredible tool to let me know if I need to make a trip to Emergency.
Pocket sized, FDA approved gadget to monitor your heart! I gifted one to someone & had to get my own. Simple to use, high quality results, easy to carry with you. Highly recommend!

The product works perfectly if you hold it with your first two fingers on the pad and thumb on the back.
Then hold it above your phone near the bottom where you talk on your phone.
Awesome item! Best compact EKG. I have a problem with my heart going out of rhythm I can check this once or twice a day and know that I am fine and even sent a report to my doctor!
For the price, this is pretty handy. It seems accurate. It does not tell you specifically if you are In Afib,, but tells you if you have signs of it. Overall it is worth the money.
Good device. If you have a person who is frail may need gel for the fingers to get a read. Must contact for 30 seconds to get a report. Nice feature is email of report within app.
Although I don't understand how the heart beat is suppose to look like. It is simple to take and tells me it's normal. It gives me peace of mind and lets me know I am not in Afib.

I have had bradycardia for years.  My cardiologist observes PVCs. APCs. Etc.  
my daughter gave me this.  No matter what I feel like or what the graph looks like. It says normal.
This device is worthless for me.  It almost always gives an inconclusive reading or says that there was too much interference.  I tried everything to fix this, and nothing worked.
A quick and easy way to monitor heart conditions and provide an overview to cardiologist of daily results between appointments.  The mobile accessory is very handy when on-the-go.
'Very good to be able to track my husband's heart rate at home.  The results can easily be forwarded to his doctor.  The chart can be printed out or read on the phone or computer.
This little gadget has helped my Doctor detect an underlying problem I have.  I believe that anyone who has any doubts about their risks for heart attack or stroke should own one!
I have used it daily since i purchased.  It works well transmitting data to my cell phone.   The company gives you an opportunity to purchase plans which allow for more functions.
Husband started having an irregular heart rhythm and the cardiologist recommended keeping track at home. This product works well with iPhone and results can be sent to his doctor.
AliveCor KardiaMobile is easy to use and connects to my phone.  It gives me confidence about my EKG as it's pretty much accurate. It's very convenient to always carry it with me.
the app is great. My only bad comment is that sometimes I don/t want to save an ECG for varios reasons (such as bad start, movement etc.). I cannot delete a ECG it must be saved.

Hi, it's a great device. I only wish it can capture the pacemaker's pacing spike, so I know whether my cardiac device is working properly.  Please continue to improve it!
Thanks!
It’s very easy to use and very comforting to know it’s right there in case you need it. Helps to be able to have these readings so the doctor can help figure out what’s going on!

This is far better than my Apple Watch.  Apparently very accurate and easy to send a copy to a doctor.  Keep a record should you need to chart a few days week etc

So easy to use
The only thing I don't like is that you need to pay for some services. Heart disease doesn't distinguish between rich and poor. Otherwise I love it. It gives me a peace of minb.
this has helped my husband and I am glad that it gives him important information immediately. The MD recommended that he get one and it keeps him feeling secure about his heart.
I have learned to never go any where without my phone. I have confidence in my Alive cor ,as I know it confirms what is happening at the time.,and relays it to my cardioligist..
at times (once or twice a day) it takes several attempts to start the ecg. When the  tracing begins, the timer isn't running in some attempts. There are also a lot of artifacts.
I love this little gadget! I suffer from anxiety so being able to tell the difference between a panic attack and an actual heart issue has given me piece of mind! Simple to use!
It seems like you have to be in a silent cave completely still for this to get a reading without 'interference'.  I get a reading that looks like an EKG about 1 out of 10 tries.
This is the coolest!! Anyone that has had A fib or other heart rhythm issues has to get this app.  It is in my tool box, but not always on my phone.  I never travel without it.

We had to take ours back as it didn't want to always work
It would work once than the next couple of times it wouldn't 
then again it would not sure what was wrong. Maybe just a lemon
This device is so easy to set up and then utilize to produce quality EKG graphs. The output compares quite favorably to the graphs I have in my file that were professionally produced.
I got this for my husband thinking it would let me know when he was in atrial fibrillation  but it is not sensitive enough and the doctor did not recommend buying it when she saw it .
Cool device.  Cannot detect if you are in atrial fibrillation or not, but it does show rate and abnormal rhythm if you are in one.  Nice additional piece of equipment for home health.
Even placing the device directly on or next to the phone it is extremely difficult to get a good or great signal. So often I get an interrupted test and have to start all over again.
I am prone to an irregular heart beat that is never captured while in the doctors office.  With AliveCor, I can record the arrhythmia and email it to my doctor.  Great little device.
Very easy to use and the app is great.  This is the best tool for anyone with any cardiac issue.  The entire setup was easy and now I have regular data to provide to my cardiologist.
I bought this for my sister so when she didn’t feel good, she could check this devise and contact her dr if necessary. I think it is a great tool for people who run the risk of afib.
Great device for checking your heart rate..very handy and convenient size for taking it with you if you must.   Best Buy shipment was quick and easy.  Dare I say, better than Amazon!
The monitor is easily paired with the app. Pretty accurate. But it is not useful for people with short episodes of arrhythmia, because it takes time for set up and launching the app.
I purchased this device at the request of my doctor since I have experienced both A-Fib and flutter in the past.  This should help me monitor what is happening between doctor visits.
My dog has a heart condition and our vet recommended that we get a KardiaMobile. I am blown away by how easy it is to use and send the ecg's to my pups vet. Its also super accurate.
Its great.  As a retired physician with paroxysmal atrial fib and occasional flutter, it makes it easy to check my rhythm at home.  I like being able to print it if I need a record.
I just ordered by first Kardia mobile device and the process was smooth and way. My cardiologist recommended this device. It’s very simple to use and gives instant cardiac feedback.
The thing crapped out after four uses. I'm guessing the battery needs to be replaced, but I don't think it was unreasonable to expect this thing to last more than a couple of weeks.
Excellent product. It does exactly what was advertised. I am using it to help check recent concerns and being able to get a quick reading when symptoms arrive, brings peace of mind.
Extremely helpful for arrhythmia detection on oneself, family, friends and acquaintences in remote circumstances where access to an ECG is not available. Treatment is thus hastened.
I have used my KardiaMobile to check for occasional AFIB events. The Kardia was the only method my Cardiologist could use to conform it. ECG & Holter monitor did not catch an event.
I am pleased with the level of comfort I receive from knowing that my heart is within normal ranges for rhythm.  also to add my blood pressure at the time and review with my doctor.
My cardiologist recommended I get a Kardia Mobile. Its so easy to use. I like the peace of mind it gives me and the potential for accessing my physician quickly with real time data.
Pairs up nicely with my Samsung Galaxy S8+ phone and works quite well.  Also allows you to add your own blood pressure readings and any applicable notes for that particular reading.
Dealing with some lingering COVID 19 symptoms and this has been a godsend for monitoring purposes. The app makes keeping track and monitoring trends very easy - great peace of mind!

[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I purchased the KardiaMobile EKG monitor after my cardiologist recommended it. Being able to check my heart rate with this pocket-sized monitor gives me a quiet sense of peace.
I'm not in the medical field, but I do check my heart rate often.  This device does show a reading like an EKG on the phone app.  You do need to press firmly for a good connection.
System works fine, but i have difficulty while walking. Get results after sitting down and have hard surface under sensor. Also need my fingers multiple times to get a good signal.

Very helpful in documenting mechanism
of ectopics in clinic setting. Ability to identify and document arrhythmia within a couple of minutes
And send email and print hard copy
My daughter, an RN for 14 years gave me one for my iPhone 5s. It comforts me when I'm anxious . I love it as though it were a part of me. God Bless the creators of this device!
I have found AliveCor to be helpful in situations where I would like a rhythm strip to confirm an irregular rhythm on physical exam or try to figure out the type of tachycardia
I have atrial flutter which has degenerated at times into atrial fibrillation.  The device allows me to check my rhythm and also transmit to my cardiologist the rhythm I am in.
Very good for the technology available. What would be great would be a watch that could monitor full time and log any events that take place.24/7. Maybe sometime in the future.
I have afib and this allows me to keep track of it. I have a little bit of connectivity issues on my new iPhone 11 but when I was using it with an android phone I had no issues
I showed the graphs that this device generated on my phone to my cardiologist and he was impressed with how clear and detailed they were. I was impressed that he was impressed.
I ordered this and am so happy I did.  Easy to use, gives me a good read out and just kicks my feeling of knowing what is going on up a couple of levels.  Love it--thank you!!
Accurate, easy to use and to interpret, and readily accessible emailable results.  Highly endorsed both by me, and by my cardiologist.  Very reasonably priced for the service.
Purchased for my Father who lives by himself. At 86 yrs of age and having tachycardia, he feels much more comfortable being able to check his "heart" and what a heart he has!!
I was newly diagnosed this year with AF and the most difficult part was not being able to prove to my doctors that I was having episodes. AliveCor has giving me peace of mind.
My AliveCor Mobile ECG has given me piece of mind.  My cardiologist reviewed the data so now I know when I don't need to worry about an irregular heartbeat.  Great technology.
It would be helpful if you had a phone number to call about questions or an email chat address. My EKG even when normal does not always give me a brief message to that effect.
The software and emails gave me confusing instructions about account setup, which required me to ask for clarifications.  The clinician review of a report I thought was bogus.
The product was easy to install on my phone and easy to read. It exceeded my expectations in giving me an accurate picture of my heart activity. It was also reasonably priced.
Outstanding medical device. Easy to use. Extremely accurate. Notifies you of your current cardiac condition! Recommended by all Cardiologists. Wish I made the purchase sooner.
Great device to be able to have a medical-grade EKG heart device. Instead of going to the hospital to have an EKG recording, I can do it myself at the comfort of my own home.
Having suffered from a heart attack in the past as well as a stroke from A Fib, I thought this would help ease my mind if I had this machine to check my EKG on a daily basis.
When I asked my cardiologist if this device was “the real deal”, he reached in his pocket and took out his. He said he uses it on his patients. Needless to say, I bought one.
I brought my KardiaMobile in February 2022. I have an Samsung Android Smartphone. As of this date May 2022, I have not be able to connect the KardiaMobile with my smartphone.
I travel quite a bit and take my AliveCor with me.  On two occasions while flying, there were medical emergencies that I responded to where I found the AliveCor to be useful.
Very Impressive and accurate tool to check your heart between doctor visits. Also, will alert you to possible problems that should be addressed when you visit your physician.
Great addition to monitor heart rate aside from BP monitor in case of emergency situations for my mom who had 2x atrial fibrillation episode. Hoping no episode in the future.
accurate, inexpensive and handy.  I've used it several times over the months since purchased and it is a solid performer.  I like being able to send data to my doc if I like.
Our cardiologist suggested my husband get one to keep track of his EKGs at different times. We purchased this and have been very pleased with the ease of use and portability.
I bought this for my husband who often thought that his heart was beating "funny" - too fast or irregular. Now, he can check his heartrate whenever he wants to, and it gives him peace of mind.
While I had my iPhone 5 I used the AliveCor often. I felt I was doing something to keep an eye on my heart health. Unfortunately it is not compatible with the iPhone 6, so I no longer have it.
Nice to have confirmation of an A-Fib attack, even though it was very obvious it was happening.  At times it messed up the pulse rate needing a retake so to speak but the tracing was right on.
I have afib and I just received my KardiaMobile. It has already given me a great peace of mind. It's very comforting to have the ability to check your heart rhythm and pace at your fingertips.
Works great  Liked the previous spreadsheet review format better  Wish I could link to cutting edge technology advances regarding A-Fib from my app.  Thanks for a great product.  Regards,  Don
KardiaMobile is easy to use. Handy way to send detailed info to my physician. What I don’t like is the constant marketing to upgrade. Makes me believe the the basic model I have is inadequate.
Very easy to use for a quick picture of your heart health at a moment's notice.   Ideal for anyone that is monitoring their heart issues or that is simply interested in staying heart healthy!
The only issue I have had is a weak signal from the finger pad to the phone and ipad devices.  Have changed batteries and altered finger positions but to no avail.  Otherwise a useful device.
I bought this unit to monitor Afib. I use it 2-3 times per day. Works great and is so easy to use. My cardiologist told me that it is very accurate and gives results as good as a medical EKG.
Glad that I received it. I feel better just to be able to check my heart when ever I want to. I’m in my late 60’s  My Mother had heart problems. So now I can keep up on my HEART ❤️. Thank you
TV commercials rave about the device and it's original cost. However, in order to continue benefiting from the device, you need to subscribe to software that gives you the readings. Not nice.
Waste of money. Can not download the app to my phone. "Not compatable with your Samsung phone". A complete waste of time and money. When you can not use the product you get a very bad review.
The Kardia mobile ekg app is very easy to navigate and track not only my reads but also my blood pressure. This has made it easy to share my health information with my primary care physician.
The larger version designed to fit on the newer iPhone can only be removed by force so I was unable to use it. When I used the earlier version it worked pretty well but now I don't have one.
This device works exactly as I expected.  I am amazed that such a small device is so powerful.  I like that you can email or text results directly to your cardiologist.  Really just amazing.
Very good way to monitor heart arrhythmias such as PVC's, atrial fibrillation, slow heart beat (bradycardia) as in heart block and fast heart beat (tachycardia). It is handy and easy to use.
Always the technicians are fast and accurate. DrDave tries hard. Main issue is reported squeal heard by some when electrodes are touched simultaneously. If a one-device bug, please replace.
This is a great product. We use it in conjunction with the Omron Evolv and it gives us a full picture of my husband’s heart health. Plus we can log the information to share with his doctor!
fantastic game changing technology, puts monitoring literally in the hands of patients, increases accessibility to monitoring to all sorts of populations, looking forward to future advances
The AliveCor heart rate monitor and mobile App is the most accurate, easy to use, and useful personal ECG I have come across.  Its in a class of its own.  Every smartphone should have one.
It is frustrating that I get too much interference message.  I did learn to press my fingers down harder which does help, but I have yet to get a perfect reading.  I might return the unit.
The product works well but comes with hardly any instructions. The website you connect to is not very user friendly. It is very easy to use but hard to figure out how to print off results.
This was helpful in picking up new a-fib that was not found on Holter. It easily has helped id episodes by having it with me at all times.  I only wish it was easier to do a lead 2 strip.
medication app is frustrating and makes submittal inaccurate. I refuse to list medications chosen from a list that does not allow me to put in the correct dosage.  See real problems here.
The main job is to record your heart rhythm. It does this well. The various other bells and whistles (especially recording medications) can be confusing with too many clicks to get there.
This is a very good device to have, especially if you have or suspect you have intermittent heart rhythm issues. You can check your heart as soon as you start feeling palpations or other symptoms.
I have utilized my AliveCor unit for over 4 years and I am very pleased with it.  It is easily utilized and being able to keep my physician aware of my heart rhythm has been very beneficial to me.
Very dependable and have used it for years to assist with AFib. Recent Apple iOS sound recognition settings caused some interference but was able to be resolved by responsive Kardia support staff.
Generally very good. I can almost always identify the p waves Beginning of tracing lots of static event tho I hold the device the same way- sometimes the tracing is horizontal other times vertical
Shipped quickly, product quality awesome, easy to set up and use. I am pleased with purchase , would recommend to anyone needing to track their heart rhythm and It was recommended by my physician.
Easy to use and multiple features. However I was surprised I had to also pat an internet fee to take advantage of all features. Ok…but needs to be clarified in the marketing. Somehow I missed it?!
This product by AliveCor is outstanding and a great comfort to me.  As an older person, having the ability to take a simple cardiogram at will is most comforting.  I highly recommend this product.
Portable heart rhythm tracker, exactly what I needed on hand to capture my elusive episodes. This device helped me progress past diagnosis stage because my doctor could finally analyze something.
I love it because it's accurate, gives me freedom, reduces stress and saves me from many trips to the doctor.  Customer service was very responsive on the 2 occasions when I needed a replacement.
I am being bugged about writing a review before I can even log on to follow directions to operate, because I cannot find a “Welcome email” that I do not remember receiving and is not in my inbox.
My AliveCor ECG works great.  I am able to monitor Heart Palpitations.  This device alone helps me feel good.  It other Heart issues should occur, I feel confident AliveCor will provide analysis.
The item is easy to use and gives you an idea of how your heart is acting at the time.   It lets you know if you should be contacting your doctor to further test you for abnormal heart functions.
It was simple to setup and works as expected.   Easy to keep with you in your pocket or phone case.  Usually have to wet your finger tips to get a continuous connection for the 30 seconds needed.
Bottom line -ok. Does not detect flutter, which is problematic for me. I have learned when the message is not able to detect, it is probably flutter. Your customer support (Allison) is excellent
Intermittent performance  when it works it works fine but unfortunately it doesn't work very often. I  followed the troubleshooting guide changed the battery. I find it to be a marginal product.
I'd go into AFib off and on but never when the Holter Monitor was on. It was very frustrating. Now, with this mobile ECG I have been able to document them and show my cardiologist. It's so easy!
We have trouble with new technology. However, had no trouble getting started using kardiaMobile. We can look at reading and tell if PVCs are present without subscribing and paying monthly fees.

I currently purchased the KardiaMobile from AliveCor. I am a woman 63 year old. 
Very easy to create an access to the App. Can recognize an Atrial Fibrillation. Very useful. Highly recommended.
As an experienced ECG reader I find the quality excellent. If you don't read ECGs they can be emailed to your doctor for interpretation. The nice thing is that you can make a recording anytime.
My cardiologist recommended this so we could keep a close eye on my heart rhythms. I find it very easy to use and good to be able to send him a copy of the rhythm so he can see what's going on.
This is an incredible app, AliveCor tool and the service it all provides. With AF, I send my EKG to my Cardiologist for monitoring each day..   Thank you for this awesome medical advancement!!!
Thank you for creating this great piece of safety equipment. It is easy to transport and gives sufficient data when I am not feeling my best and need to share this weekly report with my doctor.
Just purchased this as recommended by my dentist neighbor who uses one for his heart condition.  It works great and you can get Physicians to read results with an option. Would highly recommend
I have used Alive Cor on about 100 or more young adults as a screen for arrhythmia. If patients have any positive markers they are sent to Cardiology but a quick Alive Cor is reassuring to me.
Is small, easy to connect to your phone or monitor.Give you a baseline trace of your heart rhythm, I don’t use for diagnosis but if i don’t feel good i can see how my heart is handling things.
I found the Alivecor very helpful in sending reports to my cardiologist immediately after having an event.  I have recommended AliveCor to many others including several physicians I know.
My cardiologist recommended it. It works well, but it worked BETTER after I paid for the subscription. And that feels a little sketchy. I got different readings until I paid. Why is that?
We haven’t tried it yet since it is an Xmas gift, but I am a little concerned that instructions were not included in my purchase. Hopefully it is not a used product, as I paid full price.
This isn't really a review, rather a comment.  I pulled my AliveCor off my old phone and it stripped off the adhesive - now I can't reattach on my new phone.  Can you tell me what to do??
Excellent in determining afib and the quick 15 min response from an EKG tech is amazing. We've shared the gadget with others  hope to see an add on for more than lead 1 and 2 capabilities

[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a great item and takes the worry away if you think you may be having and issue and good to show the doctor and keep track. It also allows you to keep track of your blood pressure.
It's great to have a tool that provides insight into how my heart is working.  Would be nice to have a way to relate the information to an EKG, at least from an interpretative viewpoint.
I may be using it wrong, although I am touching it as directed by the instructions.  It seems to be random and the readings do not appear constructive.  It provides a very basic reading.
Gave it as a gift to my parents. They are not tech savvy, but once in a while they take measurements on their own without any hassles. So, thats the great thing about this - ease of use.
Excellent device. I have AFIb and this informs me what my readings are and stores them until I go to my doctor. There is a service if I wish to pay monthly fee. But I just do not use it.

[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I like the way the device easily shows me my EKG but I am disappointed that in order for it to show Atrial Fibrillation you must pay a $99.99 yearly fee. None of the ads mentioned this.
I purchased the device just over a month ago.  EVERY reading comes back as "Unclassified"  The unit is easy to us and does show and EKG.  But at this point I do not see the value in it.
I am very pleased to say I love this product. I had an issue with......a return and wrote a bad review that I wish I could take back. I did get the promised Credit due. And I thank you.

This is an amazing product and it worked perfectly for us.  Easy to operate and
perfect to transfer the info to our doctor.  Would highly recommend this product
to anyone.  Thank you.
So far, I’ve been using my device approximately four times per day for the past week. It is easy to use and provides immediate readout results. To date, I am very happy with the device.
I bought this and took.to my doctor appointment, to find out it's not accurate. It didn't stand up to EKG results, showed afib on EKG, this price of crap showed normal. Save your money.
I have been using my AliveCor Mobile ECG for six months and it has worked very well. It is dependable and I find the weekly report that I get very helpful. This device is outstanding!!!

The only 2 issues that I have with it are: 
I think it should come with a case to store/carry it in. 
It seems to not register my touch or shuts down and I have to start all over again.
My Cardiologist advised me that if I'm in A-Fib (120 bpm) for twenty minutes, I should go to the ER, and recommended I purchase the KardiaMobile so I would know for sure if I had A-Fib.
Very accurate and dependable device.  Took it to Mexico with me and worked like a charm.  Records pdfs that can be sent directly to doctor anytime.  Works perfect with dampened fingers.
Very helpful in getting data to my doctor, and she likes it. I'm lucky to have her in my corner. The device is incredibly easy to use and dependable. Really like it and worth the cost.
Really great to be able to see if you are in a-fib.I check about 2-3 times a week just to make sure . Very easy to download the app and use after that. A must if you've ever had a-fib.
Great idea but too many ads when using.  I should be able to buy a product without having to see ads for other services. Bought it for my father and the ads made him want to return it.
Doctor recommended to use. I printed the results easy too.Wish I could of bought one with a nice carrying case. Didn't like that it doesn't have one included. Hard to buy one separate.
It does what it’s supposed to. Make sure your phone is close to the device. I returned it because my Apple Watch did the exact same thing. If it wasn't for that, I would have kept it.

What an amazing device!  I can now take an EKG whenever I have any palpitations; since the doctor doesn't know what the cause is until an EKG records it while it is happening. And it's so easy to use!

I am a full-time cardiologist with many physician patient's.  Those with intermittent atrial fibrillation and palpitations have all been encouraged to use ALivecor And have done so with great success.

Already had one from two years ago.
Purchased one for my brother who had 
Heart issues and went to the hospital .
So I purchased this second one for him
So he can keep an eye on his health 
Thank you.

Recording is unreadable due interference. This has continued for 5 days now. I have my Kardia for over a year. How do I fix it? Worked fine until 5 days ago.
I have recommended to friends in the pasr

Very easy to use - download the app and enter your information.  We have used it for about 2 weeks and have a history.  This is for one of us and spouse can be "guest" - very good information fo have.
I probably had occasional attacks of paroxysmal atrial fibrillation for many years, but it was never diagnosed despite many studies.  With AliveCor it was detected and documented within a few months.
So easy to start use and a good way to do a quick spot check on my husband.  I'm an ECG technologist and can easily interpret the single rhythm strip to ensure there are no significant abnormalities.
Still using this today for tracking my wife's A-Fib. You just download the companion app and press down on the tracker near the phone. The results are very detailed and helpful, only take one minute.
Product works and provides heart information, pulse compared to other monitors is lower. Product stopped working when iPhone needed update had to update and restart the phone for unit to work again.
We lost our neighbor, Chris, to a heart attack a few months ago. AliveCor could have spotted this and saved him. As for me, at age 68, it's a great comfort to see the chart and data whenever I want.
Because of password protection in a emergency situation to record and send to you Dr, or caregiver is very difficult and not reliable. The principal and idea is great but it is not patient friendly.
My doc recommended that I get one of these, wasn't sure myself.  But it is great so far.  Easy to set up, got a readout with good coaching from the instructions.  Very handy, easy to transport size.

the product works. thats the only pro. 
had issues creating account multiple times. a lot of the options will still require you to pay though its not tuned when those services are required overseas.
I have chronic A-fib that is typically controlled with medicine. The arrhythmias started Christmas Eve and this confirmed the fact. It was great for picking up and confirming my atrial fibrillation.
Good product to self monitor your health. When I first received product I used it daily however I’m slacked off. I like that I can use with close family and save their reports separately from my own
Easy to use and set up. If you have had a stroke and have hand spasticity it may be difficult to get your fingers on the touch pad. I had to have my husband hold my spastic fingers on the touch pad
I have been using the AliveCor ECG device for over a year. it is extremely comforting to have results instantly and for my Cardiologist to review them, gives me peace of mind to go on with my life.
Able to check ECG at home results to show to physician if necessary for visit.  Able to tell if having life threatening event or just occasional PVC or PAC.  Gives peace of mind   Very easy to use.
It's great when it works, but I only get it to work part of the time. Tried wetting my fingers, etc., but it loses signal about 2 tries out of three. Getting a 30 second reading can be frustrating.
The device works as advertised. If I would’ve understood how it worked, I would have opted for the six lead device. It’s a few dollars more, but it would give a much better view of her performance.
Easy to set up and use with the phone app. I have heart disease and worry when chest tightness or minor pain is a heart issue or only stress or effects of a bad back. Nice to have for peace of mind
Very nice and nifty device for taking and recording an EKG. Setup was simple and you can download the app for free in the App Store. In addition, you could keep a log of your EKGs for free as well.
Works great for tracking heart rhythms.  I cannot wear a 24 hr. heart monitor because I'm a life guard and they are not waterproof so I use this to track my irregular rhythms when not in the pool.
I appreciate AliveCor's Carry Pod, the reports emailed each month  convenience of sharing the reports with my cardiologist. Occasionally, I have a weak signal or no signal, but get one eventually.
I was recently diagnosed with AFib & use my AliveCor everyday to see if I am in rhythm.  It is great to see Normal show.  I recommend AliveCor to all of my friends and I demo'd it to most of them.

Finally a readily available, patient accessible device to catch those elusive PSVTs and other arrythmias that terminate spontaneously by the time patients to the hospital. What a technological breakthrough!

I bought this mainly to monitor my A-fib whenever I need to without having to go see my cardiologist. I can also send/print the readings and get faster feedback from my doctors. This is a life saver for me.

This was exactly what I needed to monitor an occasional irregular heart beat. It is simple and straightforward and as retired RN I so much appreciate being able to keep tabs on myself and see where I stand

I have a history of Afib. I take my blood pressure regularly, but can't always tell if I'm in Afib. With AliveCor I can. I also get a much more accurate heart rate, and I can send the results to my Doctor.

This gadget was recommended to me by my cardiologist.  It has lived up to all of his and the manufacturers claims ... and then some!  Now I can confirm whether I am having an A-FIB episode.  Super helpful!

My wife and I travel a lot. Whether we are at home or away we get a much stronger sense of control when the moments count. It allows me to monitor myself during times of uncertainty. A wonderful product...

The KardiaMobile is easy to use and appears to be accurate.  It is interesting to see results for my wife and me.  I have ventricular tachycardia, this device allows me to periodically view heart activity.

[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I tried for 2 days to get this to work but failed. I have an iPhone 8 and updated the iOS to 16.4. I replaced the battery in the Kardia. I got 1 second of partial response and then nothing.

I returned it.

Does what it is supposed to....measure pulse and whether Afib is present. Sets up easily with your phone. Device is touchy about completing the 30 second measurement with any movement stopping the reading.

Doesn’t give you adicuate reading of your heart it stays basic doesn’t warn I’ve had chest pain gotten monitor to see what it says and it comes back to normal synus reading when it was irregular heart beat

Using the app for about 3 years now. I got it shortly after I had a heart attack. I had been aware of its imminent release before that but it wasn't out in time or I wouldn't have delayed going to the ED.

Reliable.  Easy to check rhythms and intervals. Can obtain information more quickly than with traditional ECG. First AliveCor still working well.  Patients enjoy being able to check their rhythms as well.

Extremely easy to use. Download the app onto your phone, open it, place your phone next to the Kardia Mobile and tap Record EKG. Place your index and middle fingers on the Kardia and your EKG is recorded.

This is an outstanding product! While registering and trying out the product on myself it picked up an arrhythmia that I had and was unaware of. It's very functional and helpful when evaluating patience.

This is amazing technology that is very easy to use and alerts you in 30 seconds if that palpitation you feel is benign or a cause for alarm. It is like having access to your cardiologist 24 hours a day.

It really is a great app for me and my patients with arrhythmias. I've been using it for diagnosis in patients with palpitations that couldn't be registered. It still has some noise that can be improved.

I have lived with Afib for 11 years.  I had an ablation 3 weeks ago.  I wanted to be able to monitor my heart, post ablation.  It is so simple to use, and very reassuring to know what my heart is doing.

The ability to produce an ekg in the confines of one’s home provides a sense of comfort.
Reviewing the saved ekg files assisted me in understanding my overall heart rate as I am new to the AFib family.

I  have an occasional episode of AFib. Fortunately, I can usually feel it when it comes on, but using the AliveCor Mobile ECG gives me the ability to confirm it and email the results to my cardiologist.

Acutally this works great by the way you can just to your ekg and pulse by the way on it instead of going to the doctors office by the way it works good by the way and I do recommend it to other people.

I bought this for my Mom and it is very easy to work and is a great price for some peace of mind! We did not pay for a subscription and it works perfectly you can still send the results to your doctor!

My wife was diagnosed with afib recently and this is an excellent way to monitor her condition.  It is a little weird that is uses hypersonic sound instead of using bluetooth, but it does the job well.

This is easy to use.  Be sure that arms and wrists are stabilized on flat service to get a good EKG.  I can send it to my doctor, and he can advise me whether or not I need to go to the emergency room.

The AliveCor Mobile ECG works very well with my iphone. If I'm feeling a little strange I use the AliveCor to see if anything is wrong. Almost all the time everything is normal, so I can stop worrying.

I found the tool easy to use and fascinating. I shared it with my physician and he was impressed.  I would have contributed more readings had the device not stopped working even with a battery change.

I find this product to be very helpful.  I have a fib, and this product gives me a way to check on my condition anywhere that I may be at.
I believe this product helps with other heart conditions you may want to monitor.

The KardiaMobile monitor is easy to use and seems accurate. I didn't want to wear a watch type monitor and this one is small, compact and easy to use. I just linked it ti my phone and it keeps a record of my EKG for me.

I have A-flutter.  AliveCor was a wonderful tool to inform me about a high heart rate.  My doctor was impressed with it too. Unfortunately, since it detaches itself so easily from its iPhone base,I lost or misplaced it.

Purchased this in order to confirm whether my husband was experiencing abnormal heart rhythm and it worked quickly and accurately! Definitely a good tool to have at home for anyone experiencing any type of heart issues.

The beauty of this product is that it is so easy to use. You don't have to turn on blue tooth or wifi or location. It's very accurate. I've been using it flawlessly for many years and have bought this for friends also.

This KardiaMobile is an excellent companion and connection to my cardiologist. It is easy to use, and the PDF of the EKG reading that I can send directly to my doctor offers an excellent means of support, and security.

I have had my Kardia for a few years. I work in the medical field and wanted to see what it could do. It has never been wrong when it has said possible a fib. fantastic product and I am going to upgrade to the 6 lead.

Great product, but I returned it because 1) the item is so small!  It's like the same footprint as an average smartphone; and 2) the recipient wouldn't be able to use it since they don't have an iPhone to run the app.

Good device but basically it just confirms what I already know. When I go into AF there is no doubt, Kardia just gives me a number for my heart rate. Maybe my cardiologist will see more but I don’t see him for a while

Not only does this track your ECG, it also makes it easy to track your blood pressure by bluetooth link to certain Omron blood pressure units.  Keeps track on your smart phone both the numbers and easy to view graphs.

I'm now a bit more at ease to address my infrequent chest pain issues, having a strong case of Mitral Valve Prolapse for 40 years.  Since an attack replicates a heart attack I am much more comfortable having a Kardia

When I think of all the trips to the ER or to the cardiologist I saved by using this little tool, I am amazed and thankful that it exists. Using it gives me the peace of mind that I was missing before I purchased it.

Device has been very helpful for me in  detecting and documenting atrial fib. whenever it occurs paroxysmally.This helps me in reviewing the reasons,if any, as to what may have triggered it, and adjusting dosage etc.

The KardiaMobile is terrific.  It gives a reading showing Normal Sinus or A Fib most of the time but I get quite a few "interference" readouts as well.  Not sure why but overall it is a handy and most helpful device.

Easy to get started and use.   Bought it because my dad (72) never goes to the doctor.   Not even when he broke his foot last month.  (Still won't even to make sure it's healing correctly.... stubborn Germans.  Lol)

I like its accuracy and ease of use, but it won't be satisfactory until there is a way to provide continuous data, even if only for a limited period of time (e.g. a half hour) so that it can be used during workouts.

Great, very useful product. However, when comes time to change the battery I could not do it, neither could my son or a jeweler I took it to. The cover could not be put back in place, I had to order another gadget.

I use it with a mini I Pad and you have to actually place it on the screen for it to work. Plus it doesn't always work. You have to wet fingers or jiggle. But when it finally connects it does what is claims to do.

Bought Kardia Mobile to check my heart rhythms for afib which I have at times. Very easy to set up and use.  You can download the EKG to your email and print it out to show to your Dr. or email it to their office.

I received this last year after my heart attack. I use it all the time but the tracing gives meaningless information. The baseline is too sensitive and picks up extraneous information. But it’s probably my heart.

Got it due to having Afib. And not noticing. This thing comes in handy. There’s a memebership  a month. I tried it out liked it because it caught some others things I didn’t notice I always assumed it was anxiety

The phone clip sticks right on the back of my iPhone case. It securely holds the Kardia device
in place. I've had this device for a year, it still fits in my pocket and it's nice to have it with me at all times.

I take meds to control A-Fib. My doctor wanted me to wear a monitor for a month, which I will, but I also wanted to keep track myself. I like the fact that I can see my EKG at my discretion as often as I’d like.

Super easy to set up and use right out of the box. Wish I’d gotten one earlier, very convenient for those who have intermittent symptoms that are hard to catch with event monitoring. Very reasonable pricing too!

[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This sometimes works and sometimes doesn't. It seems to matter if my fingers are really cold. The last time I tried to use it, I just got "interference" and couldn't get it to work. Then my symptoms disappeared.

I cannot get the battery cover to correctly close.  You sent me a replacement but I can't get that to close it either.  The product is working because I have the bttery cover taped.  
VERY POOR QUALITY CONTROL

I use this device quite often. The only thing i do not like is that after paying so much for this little gadget, they want you to pay for the service on the phone as well.. as in a subscription Monthly/Annualy.

This is a well needed medical source for mobile and or on the spot information that can be a life saver. Due to update the EKG Monitor is no longer compatible with my phone, therefore it was returned.

Thanks!!

Don’t waste your money!
The first one didn’t work, do I tried replacing the battery—it still didn’t work.
Exchanged it for another one, replaced the battery, that one worked twice.
Great idea, terrible product!

But the Kardia device for medical reasons and at my Doctor’s recommendation.  It has done everything it was suppose to do.  Several persons have also purchased one after seeing the simplicity of its operation.

Easy to use, easy to set up with my iPhone. Only wish the carrying case came with it. I am waiting for it to become available. So far, I have been able to track my EKG and print the ones that seem troublesome.

Great, simple and available. I recently upgraded for my new, bigger phone iPhone 5, and its much easier to use. I monitor myself (in and out of AF) and my patients with "palpitations."  Wouldn't be without it!

I was very pleased with my purchase; besides, I beat the lines at the store, and I got this item for an excellent price. I would not have a problem recommending this item for purchase to my friends and family.

Excellent- as an athlete and with issues that lead ( not heart issues) to sometimes quicker heart or bony chest pain the ap is fantastic for taking heart rhythm issues or ischemic issues off table - excellent

The KardiaMobile is very handy and so easy to use.    I showed it to my CardioThoracic surgeon and he loved it.    I have identified Atrial Fibrillation on numerous occasions.  I just bought one for a friend.

It is The perfect way to evaluate parients in my office and see The heart rhythm after am ablation. Unfortunately is nos avaible all over The World as in argentina. I hipe Thal you can do something abrir this

Recently I have had some problems with A-Fib.  Alive Cor EKG monitor, helps me determine whether my heart is in Sinus Rhythm or not.  Thank you for making this technology available for such a reasonable cost!

I like the monitor. It works as advertised. I gave 4 stars because it constantly bugs me the requests to switch to professional mode. I don't want to pay for it because I can always send the EKG to my doctor.

Very good value. Takes diagnostic rhythm recordings that can be downloaded to your smartphone and emailed to your doctor or other recipient. For a fee, tracings can be sent to Kardia’s experts for diagnosis.

[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I like having this reader after having a heart scare. Ive used it on myself and a couple other family members. The app lets you record the result history by name. It's easy to use and gives me peace of mind.

Love AliveCor's portable EKG! Great noise filtering and reliable results. It is perfect for a quick EKG. Would love to integrate it with critical care platforms like Code Runner to take it to the next level!

I never miss a day to use the app to test my heart . I share the history from my app with my cardiologist each time I meet with him. This app gives me peace of mind that I am doing well following my surgery.

Buried somewhere deep in the marketing for this device is a warning that it does not work if you have a pacemaker (I have yet to find the warning),  That proviso should be put "up front" and made more clear.

I’ve had it for a few weeks now and love it , I really like that I can also put my blood pressure on there and also email it to my doctor(s) if I have any concerns and they can see my results for themselves.

Was suggested this by the cardio nurse to track at home and it works perfectly. I’m glad I decided to ignore some of that bad reviews. I believe the ones with negative things to say aren’t using it properly!

Recommended by my cardiologist, easy to use, accurate, helped me capture readings of the palpitations I was having and share them with my cardiologist to make a care plan. I would highly recommend this app.

Only 1 out of 20 recordings showed anything other than Uclassified. The one that showed up was Possible Atrial Fibrillation. I have tried different positions, different fingers, everything I could think of.

My son purchased this product at recommendation of cardiologist and it fit my IPhone 5 but that phone died and now have IPhone 6  and is not compatible.  Is there some sort of adaptor that can be purchased?

I will be taking  it to my cardiologist as my halter monitor may not capture all my heart rhymes, not on long enough. It keeps the history and I use it each time I feel my heart acting up. Saved on my iPad.

This works great.  I didn’t know I was going into Afib every day until I got this. I’m having an ablation soon and I wouldn’t be taking care of this without Kardia mobile. Thank you for making this machine.

Love having this available to us. Much more convenient than older larger machines. Makes pets less stressed during testing :)  Easy e-mail results , we are able to attach them to the patients record in seconds !   LOVE IT !!!   :)

Item was available in-stock and east to locate in the store.  I was running short on time for a Christmas Gift and couldn't wait for an on-line purchase.  Sounds like a silly gift but the message is that I want her to live longer.

I love Kardia mobile it brings me peace of mind. I did by the clip to hold the device on my phone and it's bent I've been writing customer service without a reply perhaps you can give me a phone number to reach out to exchange it.

I really like having the AliveCor monitor. It helped me convence my Doctor that something was wrong with my heart. I had told them twice about a fluttering feeling but the dismissed it, until I showed them on the AliveCor monitor.

Very hard to get this thing going. Changed battery to see if things would improve. Contacted Kardia Support for help. Unit only seems to record if its rubbed hard with a damp rag. Not happy with the purchase. Looking for a refund.

Works much better than my old one. However when I work hard, and can't breath, it always says; too noisy UNREADABLE. As soon as I sit for 10 or 15 minutes and can breath again, it then tells me I am normal. I knew that without it!

I have not used it yet because I didn't know I would have to pay a yearly or monthly fee to use. I thought paying for the machine was all I had to do to use. o for now its put aside until I can afford to use it which may be never.

Purchase was ready for pick up on the same day download the app and start using and recording immediately.  The data that results from taking a reading is very informative. It's easy to use and it's very portable recommend to all.

My KardiaMobile is a real life-saver. I keep my cardiologist updated on my heart rhythm.  So far doing very well after cardio version and ablation procedures.  So simple to use, and the regular reminders to check it  are awesome.

I love it and can use it for family. You have the option of emailing them their results. Love it and it came in handy when I had a medical emergency they were able to have a snapshot of what was going on at the time of my issue .

This is a pretty good item.  The Wife has a heart condition that she is able to monitor "unelectrically."  But this device gives her a back up feeling of security.  (And I periodically "fly" it just to confirm I am okay as well.)

The only reason I did not give the KardiaMobile 5 stars, is at times it can be a little challenging to make good contact on the pads from my fingers.  Tracks my heart history and allows me to share the information with my doctor.

I was very impressed with how easily everything connected and the ease of navigating the app.  As someone who has just recently been diagnosed with AFib, it is great to know that I can easily capture my EKG anywhere and any time.

I use mine daily it was able to pick up my PVC and PAC although I had to send it in for reviews to find this out but was able to show my dr which is great I wish it could tell you more than AFib but I can't leave home with out it

Since I have a condition that needs to be monitored and my battery in my lynx monitor died and they cannot replace it I use it if I feel the condition acting up. It gives a good reading and it will tell me if it in heart or gas.

My cardiologist told me to buy this and email the reports to him, as the paroxysmal episodes were usually over by the time I got to the ER. Once I sent the reports to him he could diagnose my problem. Worth every penny and more.

Difficult to use. Directions say light touch; however I have to press very hard and at times still can't get the ecg to run. It's been a good tool when it works to monitor my A-Fib and A-flutter and recently added weight and BP.

The Kardia monitor gives me a good look at how my heart is behaving. It has already paid for itself by showing me what is good and what is not with my heart and helps with not having to run to the cardiologist--or when I should.

Excellent equipment and app. I can always check my rate and rhythm anytime and have been able to email my cardiologist with any ectopic.   I have referred several others to the website and they have purchased the system as well.

While at work I felt flipping and flopping of my heart.  I checked with KardiaMobile and it said A- fib.  I went directly to the ED and it was correct.  I have lost 2 family members to PE from A-fib. I tell everyone about this!

Kardia Mobile was the perfect gift for my Father. He many times over exerts himself,  and this simple diagnostic tool, gives us reassurance and peace of mind, especially, living an hour away from him. It was money well spent!!!

The AliveCor ECG is great for on the go monitoring of your heart.  I use it especially following exercise.  I would otherwise never be able to see my heart rhythms unless at the doctor, so having this portable option is great.

Very easy to use. I know that I have aFib, and this device confirms this every time - no false negatives (I.e. no statements that I have a normal EKG). My wife has normal heart rhythm, and this is also confirmed by the device.

My score would have been a strong 5 however, when I send my weekly report to my doctor he is unable to see the charts..here are his own words..."the image that you send just shows up as a black screen on my email". Thank you!

I am a medium risk heart disease patient, due to familial and individual risk factors.  Having the ability to monitor more closely my ECG regularly, and to share it with my physician, has brought me substantial peace of mind.

Having the Alivecor KardiaMobile ekg has enabled me to check my heart rhythm daily along with my other vitals and record them in the KardiaMobile log. I will be able to show my doctor snapshot of my vitals taken at the same time of day.

Got this during the Covid lockdown.  Unbelievable how this actually performs a fairly reliable EKG.  Even my cardiologist thinks it is fairly accurate. In fact, he recommended it to me and I was able to PDF and email the results to him.

I contracted the Covid-19, was hospitalized and suffered severed lung damage. While I was spared heart damage, just having the ability to show my cardiologist as well as pulmonologist a medical grade EKG was a plus that impressed them.

I couldn't catch what was going on with my heart but got this device and was able to show my cardiologist what was going on. I would totally recommend that anyone that has A-Fib problems to get one of these to keep check on your heart.

Few devices have had so much potential to catch possibly dangerous rhythms with affordable cost and flexibility.  The power of heart rhythm capture now can be in the palm of your hand with your cell phone and this device with its App.

This is a very nice portable EKG monitor. I bought it for my daughter that has had a heart issue when she was younger. She connected it to her phone using the app and she actually uses it. Being small and portable makes it convenient.

The only downside to my AliveCor device is that the battery does not last long enough for me.  Also since I purchased one of the first models I am tied to continue using my current iPhone.  It would be nice to have a trade-in program.

The sinus rhythm looks irregular but it keeps saying it's normal.

Also--I was persuaded to buy a clip as well as the monitor--but there was an exact copy of the extra one i purchased included right in the package with the original.

I thought I would have to attach it to my phone in order for it to work but I am able to use it in my hands.  It works very well but I haven't had to send any information to my cardiologist so I don't know how that feature would work.

We downloaded the app and tried to connect the device. We had problems and after 4 emails with the manufacturer, we gave up and returned it to Best Buy and got a refund. It was hinted that our smart phone may not have been compatible.

Sometimes get interference - that looks a bit like an atrial flutter but is too regular and too intermittent to be such.  Auto detection algorithm occasionally confuses multiple PAC+PVC as afib, but is probably more than 95% correct.

I had no trouble setting up and getting the results. Where I need help is in how to transmit the information to my cardiologist. I have searched but can’t figure it out. My doctors assistant didn’t know either. I could use your help.

Got a baseline rhythm strip upon receipt of device, then several months later recorded strip with bigeminal rhythm at home which was very useful in demonstrating arrhythmia to ER Docs. I carry the device in my wallet without problem.

This is the 2nd Kardia I have. The first one got lost in the hospital after I had a stroke. I'm amazed how Kardia gets better and better. It gives more information than just if you are in afib. It has become part of my daily routine.

Have done all the tricks suggested unable to get a reading. Cont . Says too much interference . Worked fairly well in the beginning  very poor at this point. My cardiologist agrees with me that there is something wrong with the app .

I like the idea and it works pretty well. What I wish is that more info is provided when it comes out unclassified. That certainly can freak someone out (meaning not sure if I should be concerned or not). What does it even mean?????

My husbands cardiologist recommended this so he could monitor his heart.  He takes an a reading everyday and sends it directly to the Doctor's office where it is read.  Of course if he thinks he is having problems he would call 911.

My husband has erratic heartbeat, we purchased the KardiaMobile .It is astonishingly simple to setup and use. we simply emailed the results to his Dr. who really liked the ability to keep track of his patient, as often as he needs .

I was under the impression that the device was able to evaluate 6 different rhythms, but turns out that is only if you subscribe to their monthly service and otherwise it apparently only evaluates 3 rhythms (one which is 'normal').

Typically, my afib is accompanied by an increased heart rate. If my heart rate remains below 100 bpm (which is rare in afib), the device will accurately report the afib condition. If my heart rate is 100bpm++ the report is useless.

Having effectively only lead 1 is somewhat of a limitation.  P waves not always seen well in this lead.  Would be cool if you had a blue tooth electrode for the Lowe abdomen or leg to try to get inferior leads to see p waves better

Unable to give a rating due to the item not being compatible with iOS 14.2.  That is not the fault of the item I bought, but the timing of the iOS upgrade.  Undoubtedly at some point in the future both items will become compatible.

As a patient with inappropriate sinus tachycardia, the AliveCor mobile ecg provides me wth tenjnfoemation I need to document and collect data in my tachycardia episodes.  It allows me to email the ecg to my cardiologist for review.

Inconsistent readings.  Havecdifficulty getting a good reading.  Improves if you dampen fingers, bur even then sometimeschad issue.  Had a couple negative results, so went to specialist.  No issues.  Questioning accuracy of device.

After a few days of use, resting and active, compared with results in doctors office he was impressed. Very easy to carry around and test anytime. I am very happy with the purchase and the knowledge & peace of mind it provides me.

this unit does not serve my purposes. further it is useless after the initial period since i have to pay a monthly subscription fee. the unit is not inexpensive and paying more each month doesn't provide me with value added.

Constantly says EKG can't be performed because of "interference ".  Huh?  I am alone, in a room, with no TV, radio, and in complete silence.  It's kinda important for it to work consistently.   If I could return it, I would.

If you are experiencing Afib, this small but needed device is a must. Dr. Recommended to me for daily checks and reports. Does the same then EKG monitor does in the hospital or Dr's office. Create reports for every check up.

I have had a pre-excitation syndrome since childhood plus occasional bigeminy.  Alive-cor allows me to check my rhythm and adjust diet, activity, or meds without getting a rhythm strip done.  Easy to share at Cardiac appts.

I’m not sure if it’s just my device, but I’ve found that the Kardia sensor needs to be *very* close to my iPhone for it to connect. The sensor and app seem to be working great, although I’ve used it only a few times so far.

Recently diagnosed with AFib.  My Cardiologist recommended KardialMobile.  He gave me a demo on his iPhone.  Since I live 30 miles from the Dr. the KardiaMobile makes it easy to send the Dr. an EKG anytime one is requested.

I didn’t know that the battery could be replaced so I bought Kardia after a few years. Now that I’ve seen it without the plastic holder I still can’t figure out how to close the small plastic circle that holds the battery??

Was feeling heart fluttering and fast rate and not abe to see my physician about it for 2 months.  Ordered the cardia mobile and diagnosed myself with Atrial Fibrillation.  Called the doctor and they got me in 3 days later.

Does not work. I was able to link it up two times. Then it died. I left a message but no one replied. Please. I would like a replacement. I need is ASAP. Thank you. Sorry for being a burden but it really just stop working.

I have been having feeling of exhaustion for many years.  Doctors couldn't find anything.  I recently purchased the KardiaMobile and had serious exhaustion issues on 1/31/22 and 2/1/22.  Told my doctor and triage nurse.  They had me come in for an EKG and to see the doctor on 2/4/22.  Everything was normal, especially since I wasn't having and issue.   My doctor ordered an Echocardiogram to ben done at the hospital on the 16th and set up to wear an extended heart monitor on the 21st.  Well on 2/10 I had another serious issue, 157 BPM according to KardiaMbile.  It faded away, it seemed.  Then on 2/11 it came on strong again so I went to the hospital emergency.  I was considered a patient who needed urgent care because their EKG showed I was in Atrial Fibrillation with BPM of 160.  My daughter originally thought on 2/10 that I was having a panic attack.  My Fir Bit Watch and my Pulse Oximeter did not show anything.  My heart rate on them was normal.  Thank you KardiaMoible.  You may have saved my life.  And I originally purchase KardiaMobile for curiosity and fun.

Dropped support of the iPhone after IoS got to a certain level--then you had to buy a new Kardia--BAD.  Then, no longer made the case for the new iPhone that allowed the Kardia to be integrated fully into the phone--WORSE.

Based on a physical pulse rating the KardiaMobile proves to be quite accurate. It also shows me how inaccurate my FitBit, pulse oximeter and my BP cuffs are. Highly recommend it for anyone needing accurate heart rate data.

I found the product to be very easy to use after getting it set up in my iphone.
Called the customer service number, and found that I actually misunderstood the documentation.
I believe that it is a very sound purchase.

The pad seems to work as advertised, my cardiologist was aware of the process and open to sending him the results for reading if any anomalies were noted. The startup process was easy to follow and the app is easy to use.

Have been having weird heart palpitations since March and could not capture on holter monitor.   Less than 1 week after I purchased I captured afib with this.  Very glad I purchased! It was recommended by my cardiologist.

Had quad bypass surgery over 10 years ago and it can't categorize the graph.  It just states that it does not recognize as any of its 'normal' or 'abnormal' ones.  It also states that it does not check for a heart attack.

This device takes the guess work of wonder if my wife is having an afib episode. It reduces the stress and worry we had before we would know for sure, this device takes the guess work out of it. It also is easy to set up.

Wow, what a simple and small device, yet what it does, it does so well. I had known about it for a long time, but have been so pleasantly surprised at how easy it is to use, and with a great interface with the health app.

I ordered it for my husband's birthday and it doesn't work with his phone.  I didn't know it only worked with a specific type of phone.  I have requested an RA # to return it but have not heard back. I need to return it.

I love my kardiamobile for quick and easy check of my ECG.  I feel more at ease with the iPhone application that goes everywhere.  I do a quick check when I feel the need and submit it for review if I have any questions.

Takes a good ekg. Sometimes it loses the reading towards  the end (not all the time) and you have to start all over again, so just make sure your fingers are warm and you don’t move around too much. Was a gift for my dad

I wish you could a devise the same device for Android as the iPhone. The stick-on is in the way on the back of my phone and after a while the metal sensor seems to work loose. Otherwise, what a great piece of technology.

Quality ekg. Works as advertised. Does not diagnose a heart attack but will pick up irregular rhythms including Atrial Fib.which is very important. Eliminates the guess work and helps prevent unnecessary trips to the ER.

Apparently it works with every Moto phone except the Moto G stylus, which is what I own. Had to pull out a very old Samsung phone for it to work. The Moto is a newer phone model, so I'm not sure why it's not on the list.

Wow! I work in the medical field and the quality of this single lead EKG is excellent. I have some medical issues and monitor my pulse. Having this to check my EKG when things are not feeling right gives me ease of mind.

I really love this product!  I have a heart condition and being able to take an EKG whenever I need to is extremely helpful.  It's super easy to use, the results are easy to read and it's comforting to be able to keep track of my heart condition.

It has a hard time linking with the bluetooth in my iphone.  It takes forever to recognize that I have placed my fingers on the device.  It's only a couple of weeks old.  I even replaced the battery, same results.  I was expecting better results.

The device is very convenient to use and seems to provide good results.  My doctor uses it in his office for a quick check before he engages the expensive equipment.  If you need to monitor your heart rate I recommend this as a good way to do it.

AliveCor is a a cool, quick way to see if a patient has an obvious STEMI, ectopy, or dysrhythmia while the monitor is still being connected.  Better yet, it is similarly easy to rule out more severe problems that envariable happen while off duty.

Worked OK until I had a pacemaker/defribulator (ICD) implanted and then interference from the electronic implant made the Kardia device useless. Don't buy if you have one of these implants. Kardia should warn potential customers of this problem!

I bought this for my father in-law who has heart issues and it makes us all feel better. It detects a problem and you can send the report to your doctor and they can review it and see if you need to come in. It also keeps a record of your tests.

Wife was diagnosed with Afib and treated.  We bought this to give her peace of mind and some data on her day to day health.  Her cardiologist was pleased to see her monitoring.

Device is easy to setup and easy to use.  Price is very reasonable.

It has saved me from making trips to the urgent care or emergency room where I would have to pay a good amount of money to get an ekg etc. Its nice to be able to have peace of mind and know when I need to take further action with my cardiologist

Displays the PQRST waves and irregularities that occur.
 When you feel your heart’s rhythm skip or pause a beat using the Kardia monitor you can see in real time what you are feeling physically and it records it so you can share with your doctor

It seems to work very well. I bought this for my husband for Christmas and we were not aware he was back in A-Fib, but this device did detect it.  We still need to check with his doctor to see how accurate it is but it just might be a lifesaver!

My Dad loves it. It was recommended by his doctor. Once I showed him how to use it, it's easy. In fact, he loves it so much he's shown it to relatives and friends a like. For anyone who has heart issues, this is definitely a trustworthy product.

My wife has been wanting to purchase a Kardiamobile for a couple of years now,  but wouldn't ever order one . So, i decided to get her one for her 64 birthday.  Boy was she surprised and only had it for a few days. But seems very happy with it.

I've only had it for a week. Sometimes it is hard to get started. not sure what the issue is. When it finally pairs up it works well. Go to my cardiologist next week. Dr. will make the final determination on whether it was worth the investment.
