For someone with AFIB, AliveCor is awesome.  You can tell if you are in AFIB by examining the heart rhythm - you can then email each report to yourself as a PDF for future reference.  For me it is an indispensable tool to manage my AFIB issues.

What is the difference between this product and the pet version?  Is there a pet  version for Android? Can either be used on both dogs and people (if I end up getting the pet one, will I be able to use it for myself and vice versa)?  Thank you!

It performs as advertised.  What they don't tell you that after the first month of using it, you must pay 9.95 per month for the premium service.  Can't find anyway to download to my PC.  Must go to the cloud and for that you pay the premium.

Bought it because my Wife has Afib and wanted to stay in tune with it.  I did her EKG, it said she was in Afib with HR at 155 bpm.  I immediately took her to ER.   I was told if she hadn't come in she may not have made it.  Glad I bought it.

I have a number of health issues I monitor daily. This is a great addition and allows me to send any irregularities to my Dr. Quite a lot of piece of mind for less than $100. Allows me to keep a history and review any trends with Dr. as well

As a cardiac nurse...I have an easier and cheaper solution for determining if youre in AFib, bradycardia/tachycardia.  Locate pulse in wrist and count for one minute. Above 100 is tachycardia, below 60 is bradycardia, irregular may be Afib.

It is extremely easy to install and to use.  Small enough to fit in my pocket or purse.  I absolutely love it.  My husband stated that it gives him ”peace of mind” regarding my heart issue.  I would highly recommend this product to anyone.

Should provide some comfort for someone with paroxysmal atrial fibrillation if rhythm is normal and alert them if they have this abnormal rhythm to contact their doctor. This little device costs much less than one ECG and an office visit.

Neat and works very well.  'Whoda thunk' you can be your own 'cardiologist-lite' at home?  Seriously, a nice device to have as a SECONDARY heart health utility (NOTHING will surpass a medical professional).  Great to have for maintenance.

Not easy to get a good EKG unless you are sitting perfectly still and your hand and the device are warm.  I'm having a hard time getting a reading after exercise.  Also, my house is cool (its winter) and the signal will often not pickup.

AliveCor has led the US in self-measure. The patient obtains insight obtained no other way. All those who want to understand their hearts are thankful for AliveCor's Mobile ECG.& the option to obtain a diagnosis at an all time low cost.

This amazing little device not only is easy to use and convenient but gives me peace of mind should I have an afib event.  It records in PDF so it is easy to email the reading to my cardiologist. Remarkably inexpensive for what it does.

Excellent tool just to monitor my heart rate and rhythm. Works pretty well. Pls be advised that this tool is not for diagnosing any medical issues. But is a great tool to give you an idea of your heart rate and possible irregular rhythms of uour heart

It's a nifty piece of equipment. It actually works (and quickly)! Easy to read instructions and easy to set up on my iPhone. Just didn't like that if you want to go deeper with your health information, you have to pay for it as a monthly subscription.

This analyzed my EKG reading and came up with normal, possible afib and undetermined readings.  I ended up seeing a cardiologist and wore a 48 hr monitor...no afib events just PACs.  So i found it to be inaccurate and therefor useless.  i returned it.

I use the device almost daily. It resolved many issues for me as an internist. Atrial fibrillation detection has increased since I got this device. I don't like the fact that it takes a while to acclimatize to the patient to give me a good recording.

works very well and keeps track for free if you have an omron app.
Be aware, when a reading is unclassified, according to my cardiologist, it simply means it is not normal nor is it AFIB, it is somewhere in between that this is not made to recognize.

Fast,Accurate,Nice Size,Good Price But to charge 9.99 a month to save the recordings and unlimited storage is an outrage not to many people can afford I didnt sign up!!!!!!!
They could do better on this !
This is the reason of 4 stars instead of 5

Easy download of app and use of monitor, The ability to add notes and BP or pair with a BP monitor is ideal . It was recommended by my physician. I have only performed a base line. I hope to capture  the extreme part of my arrhythmia when it occurs.

This works with my Motorola G7 smartphone even though it is not on Kardia's tested phone list. I do an EKG each morning and save the results for my next appointment with my cardiologist. Highly recommend Kardia Mobile for anyone with heart concerns.

I gave this as a gift to my daughter and her husband.  It enabled him to be able to note that he was in an AFib state over several days and he then contacted his doctor and is being treated.  Recommended for those with AFib or irregular heartbeats.

This is a great medical device that works in concert with my Omron BP machine.  The same software records both BP and ICG readings that I can show my doctor on the next visit.  It is user friendly and connects easily to my smartphone via Bluetooth.

The device works well with the phone AP. But not sure why I get mostly UNCLASSIFIED EKG REPORTS. even with no atrial defibrillation detected. 
It says unclassified why is that?
Occasionally I get normal sinus rythym reports but mostly unclassified.

Got this for my dad.  His doctor thinks it's cool to have the graphs when he goes in for checkups.  Little finicky with the touchpads, sometimes taking a couple of minutes to get it to detect your fingers.  Still, works well and handy data to have.

Kept telling me I had afib so I would buy the 20 dollar review for the dr to tell me everything looked alright ended up going to the cardiologist to find out nothing was wrong I kept getting mixed readings with this thing and ultimately returned it

This portable EKG monitor is great if you want to view your cardiac rhythm in one lead.  You definitely need to understand how to interpret rhythms anything beyond regular versus irregular.  For someone experienced - it definitely is nice to have.

Purchased this for my wife and myself. She was diagnosed with Atrial Fib, and I have heart disease. We see the cardiologist and maintain a healthy lifestyle. We use the KardiaMobile only to monitor ourselves between doctor visits. So far, so good!

this devise is very easy to use and set up on your smart phone. You get reminders on a regular basis to add another EKG. Small in size and fits easily into a purse or pocket, even with a case. Very reasonable price for such a high quality machine.

This is my second one. The battery was running low and I couldn't get one, so I just bought a new one! I love this machine. It gives me comfort. And that alone is well worth it! I can monitor my A-Fib. This is the best machine in the world for me.

This is a fantastic product especially for Seniors or for those who have heart issues. It is small, very easy to handle, and fast to use and the readouts are also easy to understand. You don't have to be a doctor or a techie to use it immediately.

It is reassuring to have a device that measures the pulse rate when it is difficult to do so.  When it is rapid and irregular.  Also to see the EKG and read the assessment.  Your service is very assuring at a time when you need accuracy!  Thanks!

With google and AliveCor, I think I will have a new lease on my life. AliveCor can tell me more accurately how bad my AFib Arrhythmia still is. No more guessing. It is like taking temperature or blood pressure. An essential tool if you have AFib.

Great for a quick look or regular monitoring of you anyone in your life with a cardiac concern. I have used AliveCor on myself and others in home and industrial environments and it has performed flawlessly. I would give it my best recommendation.

I've been using Kardia on my iPhone 6s for over a year.  The device and corresponding app are amazing!  However, I just traded my iPhone 6s for the larger iPhone 7 Plus!  Do I need to purchase a new case with electrodes!?  Thank you so much!  Joe

I have atrial fibrillation and have had a few catheter ablations over the past 14 years. It is very reassuring to me to be able to check my heart rate with the AliveCor mobile ECG and instantly send it to my MD for evaluation. Thank you AliveCor!

It works but do not place it on the back of your cellphone. There is no audio alarm when 30 seconds is up and you can not see the face of your phone if you have the sensor on the back of your phone. It probably works no better than an iphone ECG.

Very handy.  Could be valuable part of every primary care repertoire. There are times when it doesn't pick up the signal. Then I wonder if the battery is running low.  The next day it will work fine.  Would be helpful to have a battery indicator.

This is excellent. It gives a clear 30 second rhythm strip that it sends to any email you want. 
The only thing to know before purchasing is that you have to be in the seated position for it to work. It will not do a recording if you are laying flat in bed.

Set up was easy.  The first tracing was not too good, but I got the "official" results a few hours later after being read by a specialist (one time only and comes with the cost).  The next tracings looked better and had instant feedback from the iPhone app.

This thing is great!  Easy to use and very convenient.  Highly recommend to anyone over 50 and looking to be proactive about their health.  Cheap and easy by comparison to visiting a doctor's office.  The app allows me to email it to my doctor in real time.

I use my AliveCor monitor with an iPad, and once I found the optimum position for holding the monitor I have been getting consistently good results.  Even my cardiologist thought the AliveCor produced good ECG's, suitable for detecting atrial fibrillation.

Fantastic device!  Wondering if I was in Afib in the past and now I can be certain of my heart rhythm and my heart rate, a double benefit!  Easy to use. I place it across the iPhone so the two sides and bottom support the device and it works well anywhere.

Works great! Connected to my OMRON blood pressure monitor and keeps track in both the OMRON app and the Kardia app. Works without Kardiacare purchase, but with purchase you have access to additional readings and a cardiologist. Recommend this for everyone!

I received the KardiaMobile in a very timely manner and after following the instructions found that the unit worked just as described.  I have tried the unit after exercise, after rest and found that it extremly well.  I feel it is a very good investment.

I usually get a normal reading but sometimes I will get several interference readings in a row and a couple of times a possible a fib reading after the interference reading, several seconds after the the possible A fib reading I will get a normal reading.

The KardiaMobile Personal EKG Monitor is a very efficient method to record a reading. It provides an EKG within 30 seconds accompanied with a pulse/heart beat. The only weakness for me was that I had some difficulty getting a strong reading using my IPad.

Purchased this for my mom who has congestive heart failure.  This is was a great and accurate way to help her doctor see how her heart rhythm on a day to day bases. I gave it 4 stars because it a little difficult for her slide on and off when not in use.

I love it!  Initially, I found it a bit difficult to relax enough to get a good reading.  But it works well for me now.  I'd like to have a way to cancel out of a reading (to avoid keeping it) without first having to save it and then delete it afterward.

I stopped taking my ECG a while ago because it always showed up abnormal and the opinion of my doctor was out of sync with the reported results. When I tried to get feedback from the study I'm part of I didn't get any. Therefore, I no longer take my ECG.

I started to use Alivecor over a year ago to track any Afib episodes. I was interested in getting off of Xarelto. After 6 month of no afib, I was able to stop taking Xarelto. This has made me very happy. It gives me peace of mind to see a normal tracing.

This product was referred to me by my cardiologist. Having an electrical problem, I can check my pulse rate to make sure it’s not going too low. My husband is also a heart patient so he can use it too. A small investment for keeping your health in check!

Difficult to pair with blood pressure monitor. Difficult to export a file you can send to your doctor. These should both be easy things.  The file should go to the file folder on you iPhone. The pairing should be a no brainer. What is up with this thing?

For $80 you can't go wrong -- or can you??  After purchasing and calling for support I found out that if you have a pacmaker they do not recommend using because the reading might not be accurate.  Other than that it is amazing what it does for the price!

Very easy to get a recording.  Easy to see its completed and recorded.  the menus that follow a recording on recording symptoms, how to send it for analysis are not especially clear.  Improving the user interface and choices would make this a great app.

They have crafted a hardware and service platform that costs the cost of an important diagnostic test to less than 10% of conventional techniques.  Yeah, I know it's not a full replacement for conventional electrocardiography but it serves a huge niche.

I purchased this after a short stay in the hospital with AFIB.  EVERY reading I took showed I had AFIB, even though my Doctors were telling me I was in normal sinus rhythm. It had me upset for no reason.  I destroyed the box or I would ask for a refund!

It never picked up my Atrial Fibrillation. However, I think that is because it happens at night usually when I am asleep.  Unfortunately, my phone broke and I could not get the Alivecor off my old phone to put on my new one so I can not use it anymore.

I have pretty severe anxiety and I used to end up in the emergency room a few times a month thinking my heart was going crazy. But since I've gotten the Kardiamobile, I haven't had to go back. I can check my heart at any time and it's genuinely helped!

Like this. Have recommended it. Wish there was a way to have it attach differently. I do not want to carry it attached to my phone and have to just hold it. Wish there was a velcro type attachment. Like the system of different family members using it.

I was told by a client services rep that only AFib is tracked, and as I have other momentary heart "blips" I wish my AliveCor would record them as at least "irregular heart beat" so I could report them to my cardiologist accurately.  Many thanks, Lori

This is the second one of these I’ve purchased. The first one quit working but I still bought it again as a gift knowing what it should do! For the second one bought about a year after the first I’ll give five stars. DK what went wrong with the first.

Beware this device only last a year and a half. They will not replace it or give us any type of a discount on a new one. We cannot send it back for them to check it. It is not worth it for a year and a half. Not a good product or not a good company!!!

I think that the AliveCor monitor is very easy to use and accurate. Love the ability to see the ECG immediately. Like the analytics so  I can compare performance over time. I am currently using the monitor post ablation and the device is giving me piece of mind.

This is a great product but what they don't tell you about it before you purchase it is that you have to subscribe and pay for the app at about $10 per month in order to use it. It would be nice if they would tell you that in their advertising before you buy it.

AliveCor has been unbelievably efficient and helpful in monitoring my atrial fib. It is an efficient and user-friendly system and has provided more feedback than I would have expected. The daily monitoring has  allowed me to stop anticoagulant therapy. Thank you

The device worked only once and then it stopped linking to my iPhone. I tried removing the phone cover and replacing the device's battery but could not resolve the issue. I also tried rebooting the phone and reinstalling the Kardia app. No luck with that either.

I was actually able to record my supraventricular tachycardia which was causing me to pass out albeit occurring only every few months. I was able to capture it on my KardiaMobile. Showed my heart doctor and he scheduled surgery based on the KardiaMobile results.

Great product! My only concerns are a very faint Electrical noise when touching it now while doing things on my phone. I'm wondering if it's because I've dropped my phone a couple of times with it on the back. I've taken it off sense as to not damage it any further, however then I don't use it as often. I've used it on my dog by spraying his fur with alcohol, and it works! Also, I have seen numerous doctors here in Texas about it, including the cardiologist, and nobody knew it existed and they thought it was the coolest thing. They would recommend it if they knew easily how to get it at cetera. So really my only complaint after having it over a year is for someone to tell me what that electrical noise is, if it is harmful to me or the equipment, or my phone, and maybe it needs to be slightly more durable... But then again maybe it's fine. I would like instructions or way of how to do it while exercising with that maybe asking too much! Keep up the good work! Get an advertising program too! It's a good product and worth it!

I purchased this device because my wife thought I should have one because my blood pressure will sometimes drop as low as 59/36 or be as high as 206/105 and she wanted me to be able to take a EKG when it happened. Seems to work great and interesting to watch it.

This is a great product with a great price. I recommend this product to everybody. Great for monitoring your heart rhythm and you can see it all on your phone. Looks for reviews online and on social media and was the highest recommended and most accurate to use.

I really enjoy the AliveCor. It reassures me of the strength of my heart. It has also been helpful to friends who may have ignored problems. When they have seen the differences between their traces and mine, several have undertaken checkup they've long put off.

Efficient. Inexpensive. Can be reimbursed easily by health insurance plans. Amazing, painless-to-navigate technology. I do wish the initial cost could cover the upgrade for insights and monitoring. A slightly increased fee at initial purchase could be seamless.

This handy little phone device is easy to use when you are sitting still. Would love to see what my ekg looks like when I'm walking or doing activities. I never had an abnormal one, so I don't know what to expect. Would like more tutorials on different rhythms

The unit appears to be accurate but I have had difficulty manuvering the system without the subscription.  The best part of the service is Tom and his female associate (sorry I forgot her name) who are the most patient and trustworthy people to ever encounter.

A great little device that works.  It's not as bulky or cumbersome as the older event monitors that require you to be wired to a box for days at a time.  It offers instantaneous results as well.  No longer do patients have to wait for the results.  I love it.

The AliveCor is a great tool for both self use and for assessing others. I have used this on planes, at the mall as well as on myself when I have overworked things a bit. I am on my Second generation unit and have it with me everywhere I really like this unit

I had one of these for my iPhone 6 and it was great, easy snap on and off and was disappointed when it was not available for future iPhone products and on CNN this morning, I saw it had returned and immediately ordered it for my new iPhone 8, thanks AliveCor!

Very easy to set up and amazing in what it can do given such a small size. I haven't gone beyond testing the reading, haven't tried sending a report to my cardiologist or anything else, but that it can create my own EKG whenever I feel the need is reassuring.

Since I have had a few episodes of tachycardia (over 20 years/ 1 a year), this device helps me capture it if it happens.  Not yet.  I use in on strenuous hikes in the mountains and it is excellent.  One must be stable and patient and the reading is excellent.

The device is meeting my expectations so far. I purchased it to be sure that I'm not in AFib and, I believe, probably haven't been other than when I was initially diagnosed. This is now giving me peace of mind that I'm not.
Also, it's been very easy to use.

This is excellent App/Device for people who want to see their heart rhythm ECG instantly. It is user friendly and quite accurate.  Every Internist and Cardiologist should have it.  Patients with heart rhythm problems may benefit from it after brief learning.

Great product. Super easy to use. Well thought as cell phone accessory. 
Only minor complaint is that sending your EKG to your own doctor is not described in the app and is not that easy to figure out. Once you figure out that it has to be a pdf it’s there.

I am amazed that such a small, compact monitor can actually give you an accurate EKG. My cardiologist used this as my EKG for my appt since it was via telehealth. So, this is great to determine cardiac arrhythmias anytime you want to check. Highly recommend!

Simplest electronic device I ever got, worked right away the first time.  I liked that the first EKG had to be read by a professional (included in the cost) before you can do it yourself.  Nice to know when things are good vs waiting until there's a problem!

I bought this to verify what my watch was telling me. During my doctor's visit I told him I had bought this device and he was really pleased, as the heart Holts test did not show anything and he wants me to monitor using this device and send him the results.

I have tried multiple times on multiple days with no success at getting an EKG.  Don't know what the problem is although the comment "interference" keeps popping up - don't know where the interference is coming from as my wife doesn't have the same problem.

Terrific idea! We have the device on our iphone 6 plus. Works flawlessly! It gives diagnostic quality rythm strips, which you can email to your doctor. This is perfect for transient arrythmias. It saved a family member a trip to the ER and a Holter monitor.

Bought this for my 70 year old mom with blood pressure issues. She's always concerned about her heart. Now she can get an EKG right on her phone and know she's not going to have a heart attack. 

Shown her doctor and he's now having her email EKG history from her phone.

Just purchased this item after seeing an ad on tv. The product delivers what it promises. If you have any heart issues where you need to check your heart beat regularly without going to your doctor’s office or the hospital, this gadget is very handy.
Highly recommended!

I use the device for my father-in-law for follow-up care on a heart attack.  In this case it works well and has excellent options.    I tried using it for sports physicals screening to determine who may actually need a 12 lead ekg.  It does not apply well in this case.

I have had mine for a year with no problems. At first I check everyday but now NOT so often..I have found that the two middle fingers  on each hand does best FOR ME. I don't know how accurate it is as I have never had a heart problem. I recommend this device to anyone.

The AliveCor ECG allowed me the freedom to travel and still show my doctor what was happening with my AF. It is simple and partners with my wife's iphone flawlessly. We are usually together and therefor I always have a ECG available in an instant. Very well engineered.

I like this app., but the printing a complete report should come with the program instead of having to pay for it extra. Without the report option , you have to print each section individually from what I have experienced. This is not very user friendly in my opinion.

The EKG device works very well. It is incredibly easy to set up and use. You're able to track your heart rhythm daily and allow others to use it as well as a guest. I've used the phone clip and have it on the back of my cell phone case so that it is always convenient.

I love the AliveCor Mobile ECG device. My wife has heart trouble, so I can easily assess her ECG status and notify her physician if there is a problem. I also teach exercise physiology at Chico State, so I use it often in class. I also use it during my own exercise program.  I have several suggestions:  1. Integrate the unit into a protective case for the iPhone. My phone face cracked when I substituted the AliveCor system for an Otterbox (broke when I dropped the phone on the ground). 2. Modify the unit so it works during exercise. You could wire the phone to a bipolar lead system a person could wear during physical activity. I currently use it to check my heart rate and EKG during intense bike rides. I stop and take my EKG standing up. When I am extremely fatigued, It is sometimes difficult to get a good measurement. 3. The new interface is inconvenient. I liked the history button on the old interface. Also, the patient's name should be clearly visible on each strip.  Otherwise, I think this is a first-class device.

I feel more comfortable knowing that my heart rate is normal or not. If not I know what to do instead of just guessing and upsetting myself. I have had only a few episodes of Afib. and being able to monitor myself without a trip to the ER or doctor is really helpful.

My cardiologist recommended that I purchase this device to keep and eye on my benign palpitations and make sure they aren’t progressing to afib. The device is small and well-designed, and it’s very simple to use. It’s empowering to be able to check my rhythm at home.

Young and healthy, I was diagnosed with Afib early 2021. All the cardiologist and electrophysiologist recommended this to detect/confirm attacks. Love that I was able to share my results with my Drs. Ive had an ablation since then but still carry it for peace of mind

This is a valuable tool.. Once you make your Doctor aware that you can get immediate info on your heart and share it with him thru email or a printed copy of the scan... It has a value to your health that cannot be underestimated.. If you don't have one get one.....

As a retired critical care nurse having health issues this has been so reassuring to be able to look at my rhythm. You can add your B/P, HR and notes, you can change the length of time from 30sec to 2 min. You can also pay a monthly or yearly fee for interpretation.

stumbled on this device in sales ad and decided to try it out...very cool design and works well giving accurate readings...sometimes a little difficult to keep sync'd up but just a wiggle and gets back in line...great for a quick update on how your heart is working!

As Interventional Cardiologist, this is a perfect device for my outpatien clinic. The only problem is that contact semilunar plate is too small for some pacients fingers and after some time the attachment glue is impossible to separate it from de back of the phone.

I sold 2 doctors after I showed them my.  Gives you a comfort zone with out over reacting. It still leaves me with some questions due to a low heart rate, usually under 50 that I've had for years, prior to one Afib event 9 months ago.  Great health product and app.

AliveCor helped me to learn to recognize when Afib was present and helped me to identify triggers.  This allowed me to feel more in control and less anxious.  I also believe that having my cardiologist able to view the patterns was helpful in getting better advice.

Overall up to what it promises. Quickly differentiate normal from abnormal rhythms and even gives an idea about when a further 12 lead ecg is needed. The case can be improved to make it lighter and thinner. Low signal needs gel or water sometimes to get a reading.

I can't believe that I didn't think of this before I ordered this, but I wanted to share w/ others that if you have any implantable devices i.e DBS (deep brain stimulator), pacemaker it will interfere w/ the readout, you will get artifact and not your EKG reading.

Overall I like it and I think it's a good product. It feels though when you have to do your EKG tracing so you have to moisten your fingertips first. And it doesn't always pick up a good signal. But otherwise I do like the product and it does give me peace of mind

This device is awesome and I have been using it to detect if I am in Atrial Fibrillation since late January. It does a great job. I can create a pdf, send it to my own email, and store all results on my computer which I will then give to my cardiologist in August.

Very innovative and accurate way for me to check my EKG.  Easy to send the results to my physician as a pdf document.  I take the Alive Cor equipped iPhone with me when I am out of town.  Highly recommend Alive Cor to anyone who needs to keep track of their EKGs.

Alive Core is the best thing every manufactured for people with heart problems. I have Afib and never know when i have it which makes it even more dangerous.  With my Alive Core I can do an ECG every day if I want without having to go to the doctor to get an EKG.

I bought this to monitor my heart rate.  There have been times that I know my heart rate is elevated and I try to use it and it does not pick up the elevated rates.  It works about 50% of the time and I have returned it and tried another and had the same results.

This is an amazing little monitor! I recently began having heart palpitations in the middle of the night, and it’s very easy to just check my heart rhythm with Kardia to make sure I’m not having any serious arrhythmias. Kardia has given me so much peace of mind!

I have had mine for 2 years, I do a reading every monday and email the results to myself, when I have my yearly exam, I print out the results and take them to my appt, that way the dr gets a snapshot of the year, not just what he hears the day of my appt with his stethoscope. and

We've only had this for a few weeks now and in the short time we've had the product is accurately measured possible afib, which later in the day confirmed to be afib.  We also like the ability to create and save reports for our doctors.  Great product, wish we bought this sooner.

Good App. Diagnostic quality ECG tracings for rhythm disturbances have been obtained using this app, I am happy to recommend its use in circumstances when the arrhythmia last long enough to find and start the app, then hold the phone for long enough for a tracing to be obtained.

I have a block in my left bundle branch (LBBB). This shows up on an EKG with a widened QRS complex. I am wondering how your software will interpret this. Can it can be set as "normal" for me, or will it show as an emergency every time I use the Cardia Mobile?

Thanks in advance.

Excellent product and reasonably priced. Since I'm an M.D. it helps when reading rhythm strips. Two tricks I learned that make it work better for me are:
1. Clean the plates before each use with alcohol wipes
2. Press fingers loosely on the plates. A firm grip causes artifact.

I made several measurements and your device wrote all the time that the atrial fibrillation is possible. However, my cardiologist, whom I sent these cardiograms, said that there were no fibrillations, but there is some other problem. I wish you to finalize the device or program.

I think it’s great and convenient but sometimes it’s difficult to get a good/great connection and I have to move it around a bit to eventually get the connection despite being right next to my phone. Other than that, very happy with it and everyone else enjoys trying it as well

I bought this for a handy tool when doing medical coverage at events. I am a licensed professional and volunteer at community activities. It works well for what it is.   However, even i get confused by the artifact and the occassional auto reading of a-fib which does not exist.

I am 71 and I worry more about strokes than heart attacks. I also have asthma attacks and this  device helps me decide whether the pressure in my chest is asthma, which it normally is, or a heart problem. This device reduces my stress and thank you for developing this product.

My daughter bought this for me for Christmas.  I had open heart surgery in November.  About a week before Christmas I was feeling funny so I opened my Christmas present. It read possible a fib.  I went back to the hospital and it was right.  Possibly saved my life.  Thank you

We were not happy with ours. You have to pay a monthly bill to be able to send reports and you also have to purchase other gadgets for it to be really beneficial to have. I would not recommend this to anyone unless you are ok with making quite an investment. We returned ours.

This little device really works and my only regret is that is isn't able to cure the problems that it helps to diagnose.  Sadly, I remain in A-fib.  Don't get me wrong though.  If you have a need or concern to check your EKG frequently, this little gadget is a great purchase.

I'm an MD, wanted to figure out my arrhythmia, not AF.  Your machine was the answer--certainly not just for AF.  Not so good at p waves, but what does one want over the phone?  Your archiving is excellent, very easy to print and send tracings.  An amazing piece of equipment!

As someone who has lived with replacement Aortic valves and strokes for many years the AliveCor/Kardia Hardware, APP and Services has provided peace of mind over the last 2 1/2 years allowing me to monitor my heart during Afib episodes from aboard my sail yacht in the Caribbean, keeping my Cardiology Team in the U.S. up-to date with the status of my heart health.

Monitoring my heart each morning and oftentimes throughout the day provides the important information necessary to allow my Cardiologist to make medication decisions and recommendations for my return to the U.S. when necessary to resolve events that occur along the way.

It is an accurate, informational, cost effective tool providing peace of mind for both me and my family as well as an important medical diagnostic and communication tool between me and my cardiology team. 

As a result, I am allowed to live my sailing dream and to enjoy the of the blue waters, blue skies and warmth of the Caribbean.

Thanks,
Lee E Smith, Captain/Owner
S/V Tranquility

Fantastic device recommend by my wife’s Cardiologist for us to monitor her Atrial Fibrillation. We have used it many times and can send PDF report’s to her doctor after each EKG rhythm strip has been recorded by us. We feel this is a great device for monitoring Heart rhythm.

I had bought this product because I'd been having weird heart flutters at random times. When I was able to get the reading it showed me I had possible AFib! I now have an appointment with a cardiologist. I wouldn't have known without the Kardia. Very happy with my purchase.

I learned by-by-doing that you can't have your headset plugged into the phone when you try to do a reading. Another cool feature, if you don't want to spend the $$ for the subscription, you can download the reading into your DropBox and then easily email it to your doctor.

AliveCor has been an amazing asset to my medical work. It quickly does an ECG measurement, analyzes the results and I can store or send over any of the files. It's consistent in quality and the overall development of the technology behind the device has been skyrocketing.

I am currently 28 with chronic a-fib now I can feel when I am in and out of a-fib and I also get regular pvc which everyone has but I get more often my cardiologist told me to get one of these so I can send him my a-fib strips before I even get to the hospital works great

I purchased about a year ago after my nurse at Stanford recommended I use to track my irregular heartbeats.  Was the perfect tool until it stopped working.  Battery died and my husband replaced for me, but it never worked again. :( Haven't gotten around to replacing yet.

I used the EKG monitor several times when I first got it but then learned that one-lead is not enough to give an accurate reading of one's heart activity. I would send an abnormal report to my doctor, and each time she would say it is normal. I don't even use it anymore.

Fabulous invention - sets my mind at ease because if I feel something weird or funny, I can get some real time feedback of what's going on in my body. Very reassuring to see a healthy heartbeat, or, if something is off, to have concrete information to send to my doctor.

I thought KardiaMobile would work with a Jitterbug Smart2 because the phone is an Android 7.0.  But I was told after I purchased it that it does not.  So, I will be returning the product.  

It seems like it would be great for the app to work with a phone for seniors!

[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I got these to track what was happening with my heart. I did have to purchase the upgrade in order doe it to actually “catch” my afib attacks. Other than that I really enjoy this little device, and would recommend it id you need to see your heart rhythms for any reason.

sent mine back for a placement. Took 2 EKG readings in 24 hrs and then it wouldn't connect. Had put on the phone clip and it's so tight couldn't get the instrument out to even check the battery. Won't install the phone clip again and will return if battery doesn't last.

It is unreliable.  I find that I have to try multi attempts to get a signal that will read.  I have tried moistening my fingers and keeping my arms very still.  I have tried from very light touches to very firm touches.  Nothing works until suddenly I get a reading and several stops and starts.

While this is an excellent item works as described. What the description doesn't say is it seperates a fool and it's money requiring a monthly subscription to save the readings. I'll probably return it as I'm not looking for anymore monthly bills. Drs get paid plenty to keep that record for me.

When the device works, it gives interesting, valuable information of interest to me and to my doctor. But, more times than not it fails to record. I have tried replacing batteries and cleaning contacts. I contacted the company for help and was told the only thing I could do was buy a new one.

Just had a first Afib episode a month ago. I am happy with this purchase as I can take my own reading and understand better what I am feeling and whether I am in Afib or not. Easy to use and set up. I would recommend to those who want to gain control and understanding of their health issues.

Was going to buy my dad an Apple Watch to keep track of his heart rate and EKG... but he doesn't need that fancy a tech product. This was the perfect solution. He is a cardiac patient and so being able to take his heart rate and an EKG is so important to make sure he's stable. Great price.

By seeing the advertisements on this device I thought both pieces of equipment came in the package and the mobile part was you could take it anywhere. I was wrong and all I have is a land line so guess I won't be using this. Guess I'll have to find someone with a smart phone to give it to.

We ordered this because my daughter potentially has SVT & her cardiologist wanted us to catch it at home. The Kardia Mobile is easy to set up & use. She is 12 & it only took her a few minutes to learn how to use it. We’re considering a second one to have on hand because it’s so convenient!

I check my EKG twice a day in lieu of taking blood thinners in case Afib should strike Overall this is very convenient.  However, I wish the Alivecor app was more accurate in detecting normal heart rates, etc.  I have to repeat measurements very often since I get no reading from the app.

Really disappointed. Needs tons of other equipment to work at peak efficiency. It doesn’t like to connect to hubby’s phone, even when they’re right next to each other. He can’t get a signal. It’s big and bulky and a pain in the butt. Would not recommend and frankly, would like to return.

Works well once I determined how to keep history without having to subscribe to Cardia and have means to send ECG to cardiologist and/or print out latest readings and take with me to appointment. Cardiologist recommended in lieu of Apple Watch upgrade so it saved several hundred dollars.

Very simple to use as well as easy to set up with the required app. I am not especially tech savvy, but the written instructions were clear and easy to follow. The quality of the single lead tracing was excellent. I am so glad to have an easy way to monitor episodic arrhythmias at home.

Generally, I have been pleased with my AliveCor device.  But, every so often, I get some weird readings that can't be accurate.  My Doctor calls it "noise".  When this happens, it usually repeats itself, and I have to just put it away and try it again later.  Am I doing something wrong?

I have a Cleveland Clinic Heart Doctor and he wanted me to get this.  I have been able to track my AFIB any time of the day or night.  It has been a real peace of mind!  I never had to run to emergency, which is a big savings in itself.

I recommend this device to anyone and everyone.

May have saved my life. Bought on a whim.  Showed possible A- fib.  Went to my Dr the next morning and it was confirmed. Said if it went untreated I may have never known until I had a stroke or worse.  Possibly due to low thyroid levels. On meds now.  We will see.  Thanks KardiaMobile.

I bought this device on the recommendation of my cardiologist's PA. Little did I know it was not compatible with my LG smartphone. Very disturbed that this company does not adapt this device to my LG thin smart phone, it could be a useful device...to Apple Phone users, which I am not.

Purchased because someone we know had one to keep check on his afib. When I tried it, said I had possible afib, but said normal for my husband. After two weeks it didn’t change.  I called my doctor and immediately went in for an ekg.  I really was in afib.  Definitely would recommend.

I use your product daily since I received it. I had AFib late last year, and this little test along with a daily blood pressure test give me the assurance that all is functioning well. I have also shown to my cardiologist and told him he should look into getting for his techs. Thanks,

Having this handy device is especially valuable for individuals with intermittent arrythmias.  You are never in the Dr's office when they occur.  Being able to record a graph of the impulses to either email or discuss in person is very beneficial.  I recommend it with no reservations.

Excellent tool for confirming cardiac arrhythmia .  I have frequent a fib and feel palpitations when they start.  It confirms the diagnosis, and will be very beneficial when I visit my cardiologist.    However I did find that if the heartbeat is very fast the Ekg displays unreadable.

Ease of use and set up.  I selected the right app to get started and figured out by trial and error  to set the phone in front of the electrode pad and place pad with arrow pointing up towards the phone.  Leaving phone alongside the electrodes distorted the tracing.  Love this gizmo!

As a Cardiologist, I have been recommending this product for years and have used it to diagnose multiple patient with dysrhythmias.  As luck would have it, now I need it to try to capture my rare rhythm disorder.  This is the best commercial product on the market for rhythm capture.

There have been two occasions when the device does the electro, but the diagnosis is confusing.  It does not say it is NORMAL, and it does not say there is AF.  Therefore, no clear indications.  Is it that there are no other classifications ?  How about arythmia?  tachicardia?  etc.

I bought my Kardia Mobile 5/20 and it had problems reading me.   I have tried to reconnect to the app and it will not let me.   Spent hours trying and the screens do not look like the tutorials.   I am wondering if I just wasted money and that if I do not buy the plan it is useless.

I purchased the KardiaMobile to monitor my AFIB using my iPhone and initially was always getting unspecified readings. I found that temporary disabling Bluetooth on my iPhone fixed that issue and now it reads and outputs my personal EKG charts where I can monitor my heart condition.

Needs to be able to correctly measure if person has implanted device. 95% of the time my scans come back as "unable to determine", yet since I have an implanted device my actual ECG looks ok. My normal sinus rhythm will not fit the standard profile so I rarely get a Normal reading.

The product and the app work seamlessly and are a piece of cake to use. I had a successful cardiac ablation procedure two years ago. That said, the KardiaMobile provides me peace of mind to check in whenever I am feeling “off.” One of my closest friends (a neurosurgeon) has AFIB and highly recommended KardiaMobile.

I had a IPhone 8 and it worked well but I upgraded to a IPhone 12 Pro Max and get no signal to record ekg. They gave several ways to make it work but none of them worked. They said take off cover, change battery, turn off Bluetooth, clean contacts and some other items but nothing works and they stop contacting me.

I am very pleased that  I can take an ekg reading when I need to. The device is easy to handle. I do not like the daily request for the meds I take.The meds have not changed for a long time. Thank you for excellent service.  R Propper D.D.S. Diplomate of the American Board of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery (ret)

It is nice as a physician, who has had an ablation for Atrial Fibrillation, to see my heart rhythm randomly.  Would have been a nice tool when I was going through my paroxysmal Atrial Fibrillation events. Not sure what the BFx designation means on my saved rhythm strip.  Can't find an explanation for this term.

I was an ICU RN for 20 years.  My wife has been having "palpitations" accompanied by some dizziness and generalized malaise.  Her cardiologist thinks she is going into a  paroxysmal afib but so far we haven't been able to get a recording of it.   She even spent a week on a portable monitor but unfortunately did not experience any episodes.  After seeing this product advertised I felt it might be worth checking out....It appeared easy to use so I ordered it.  It is about the size of a credit card and once the app was downloaded it worked easily and as advertised.  The first EKG  was taken and within 12 hours the result was received releasing the Kardia for use.  I then tried the Kardia on myself and received an instant readout of Lead I and was able to print a hard copy for my records.  I feel it will be invaluable due to its small size and ease of use in diagnosing the palpitations my wife is experiencing as it can literally go anywhere she goes.   Great product.  Thank you.

Anytime I feel odd, I use the app to check my heart for AFIB.  It is spot on and allows you to keep an accurate record of your readings.  Even saw health professionals using it in the hospital when they wanted quick readings with9ut waiting for an EKG.  I have shown it to dozens of people and they are amazed.

Just received my 6L. App was easily installed and phone linked to device effortlessly. Got my first EKG with no problems. The protective case is a nice $X case. Unfortunately it costs $XX! The device is not easy to remove and the case does not stay securely closed. You might want to look elsewhere for a case.

Works well, good for piece of mind. Suggested mprovements; 1) Make it a little less sensitive to noise - if not competely still and relaxes, you don't get a usable trace. 2) I don't attach it to the phone case, so I have to remember which way to hold it - it would help to put left/right labels on the sensor.

Excellent mobile EKG. I would highly recommend for anyone that needs to monitor their EKG and be able to share the info with their Dr. but please be aware that if you have a pacemaker they don’t recommend this without consulting your Dr so be careful of that and make sure to check with your Dr before using.

Works OK but it does need major improvements. The analysis tools are very weak and often incorrect. Example: Thinks that "PAC's are Afib every time" Overly sensitive to muscle noise. Does a poor job of picking up the "P" wave. Looking at the "P" wave shape is helpful to determine if the "P" wave is ectopic.

The app has provided me with the ability to guard against the possibility of blood pooling and clotting in my heart. On the two occasions when I was discovered to be in flutter I was unaware until an ecg was performed by a cardiologist. Being assymptomatic, I could go into AF and be unaware. Now I am aware.

As I am mature, much like I am monitoring my blood pressure, I thought Kardia Mobile would be great “health tool“ to have around…. It was easy to set up and even easier to use… I am even showing it to my friends, letting them try it out…. Thanks for making a great product available at an affordable price…☮️

Superb device. The price is right. I am astonished that my cardiologist had not even heard of this, and that my GP wasn't using it to screen new patients. Your device is excellent, but your marketing is thin. No one at the Brigham and Women's world renowned center for Cardiology claims to have heard of you.

Less than a week after having my Kardia Mobil, I had an episode at work and was able to record my EKG. I ended up being transferred by ambulance to the Emergency Room but Kardia Mobil recorded the EKG's prior to medical staff arriving, so they could be reviewed and used to help diagnose what was happening.

This device has given me a piece of mind. After having A Fib I wanted to know if it was reoccurring. People assured me it could return. To date I have been blessed and have not had this problem again. The Alive Cor Mobile ECG has given me piece of mind and confidence knowing I can check my ECG at any time.

It really works.  You need to take a minute to wet your fingers and get the reading just right but otherwise pretty amazing for such a small device.  I am used to hospital grade EKG equipment, so rating of 4 stars is just my critique of the rhythm recognition that I am used to versus this basic user level.

Love having it for peace of mind, but it's real value is in the ability to instantly share results with your cardiologist. I had an episode on the streets of Chicago, took my ECG, emailed it to my doctor, and he updated my prescription all within minutes. I was back in sinus rhythm within hours, not days.

I impressed my cardiologist with my AliveCor history. It is easy to use and reassuring to have. You can get technical or medical interpretation of results should you have concerns. Only downside I worry about is what happens when I get a new phone, as the unit securely sticks to the phone it is used with.

I love the simplicity of the product. It’s accurate and easy to use. I wish I didn’t have to open an app however, to use it. Sometimes when I’m feeling an arrhythmia, it’s gone before I can get the app open.  If I could just place my fingers on the product and it automatically record, I’d give it 5 stars.

I have been in the care of a new doctor and it seemed important to know when I was in sinus or not. I heard about this device and with it, we know how effective (or not) a treatment or medicine is without having to go to the office. Without the device I am unable to reliably say if I am in SInus or Afib.

This has been in use in our house for 2+ years. It has performed flawlessly. I have compared with full size professional instruments several times, and it tracks accurately. It enables us to keep track of AFib, as my wife isn't aware when she's in it. This way, we know. Our Docs are impressed. So are we.

Be aware that PVCs and PACs can cause an “ Unclassified” or “ Possible AFib” reading. We visited our AFib clinic after a week of only 3 Sinus Rhythm readings. Clinic EKG showed Sinus Rhythm (unlike the Kardia EKG  a few hours earlier) as did all earlier Kardia EKGs this week upon review from Cardiac CNP.

Im sure that it accurate readings but im not sure what good it does if you are not a medical doctor that can read it. My mother suffers from atrial fibrillation, which the device confirmed. I guess i was hoping that it would tell me something more that i didn't  know or tell me of any troubling changes.

Your ECG monitor empowers patients to be partners with their cardiologists in managing their arrhythmias.  I demonstrated your device to several engineering colleagues who immediately purchased this own units.  They now use them for self-monitoring when they have doubts about their heart rhythm status.

I like it held me reassure myself if I feel anything that needs to catch, but the low side is, if my HR is too fast let's say one time it was beating in 150's it wouldn't read the whole 30sec and of course it won't say if it's normal or what ever. Sometimes it would do that at heart rate 105 and above.

KardiaMobile is a daily part of my life. AFib has also been a part of my life. The Kardia App Allows me to share regular reports with my cardiologist via email. It has become part of my lifestyle changes and Heart health program and management. In no way has this replaced my Doctors. However, it has proven to be a good tool.

It does what it says it will: Gives you a two lead ECG showing heart rhythm.  The basic plan includes screening for atrial fibrillation, tachycardia, bradycardia.  If other abnormalities are detected you can , for a fee, submit it for reading to their service, or print the strip as a PDF to be interpreted by your "provider"

I bought one of these years ago - and loved it because of what I was going through - where it took me time to go into urgent care - get signed in and finally hooked up to an EKG - my arrhythmias would be over by then so it took, literally 4 years to finally get it on tape  - I bought this so I could catch it as it happens -

I ordered the KardiaMoble, it came the next day, easy set up, tried it and was in the hospital for 6 days after that! This KardiaMoble probably saved me from having a stroke or other serious situations...My heartrate was 170 and I really didn't even know....Thank God I purchased the KardiaMobile.! EVERYONE SHOULD HAVE ONE1

The app has given me support for getting off Warfarin. I firmly believe my case of AFib was caused by a virus I had.  Subsequent to diagnosis, electric shock to the heart put me back in rhythm, and have been there for two years.  The AliveCor app has allowed me to successfully argue that I am no longer in need of Warfarin.

Loved the device. It sync'd up well with my iPhone and worked wonderfully. The doctors couldn't figure out what I had since it was intermittent.  They recommended the AliveCor or wearing a halter monitor for a week.  AliveCor was great. I would feel the afib and take a reading. Then it was simple to email it to my doctor.

it’s easy to use and carry and provides a very basic ekg report, but with very little detail. I like it but my doctor recommended getting the newer, deluxe 6-lead version that gives more details about your ekg. Plus if you have a hearing aid, you have to turn it off each time you use this as it does something with audio.

Very easy to figure what to do and to actually use it. I learned that the position of my phone vs. the Kardia was critical for a good signal. I wanted to send my ekg via text - but the only format I could find was a pdf which was easy to link to any email but not to a text. Need some good instructions for how to do that.

Its a great little device, allows you to better understand your heart rhythm.  It would be great to have access to alternate methods/locations of contact for it as well as more than just a "no abnormalities" message.  If you could attach leads to it, that would make it great allowing users to get more than just v1 and v2

I am very pleased to have used my AliveCor  device.  I am not under the care of a cardio specialist.  Nor have I been diagnosed with heart problems.  I wish there is a way I could take an analysis of my 100+ readings and give it to my general practioner.  Please let me know if there is a way to do this.  Thanks. . Davis

I really like the mobile ECG and app. I like that it is so small and handy and results are immediate. My problem is that doctors are not familiar with it or how to bill for an email to them. I had to make a special appointment to review it. I feel that they need to catch up with technology before it can be truly useful.

[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Biggest issue I have with this is that you have to pay an addition subscription for the service, and you have to also pay extra for additional people. However, if you have an elderly person who is homebound and cant make it to see their Dr without much inconvenience, it does make it easier to monitor their heart health.

The device can show your ekg, but sometimes with a lot of artifact. Definitely cannot work well if your fingertips tend to be very dry. Also, depending on the electrical axis of your heart, it may not be able to consistently interpret your tracing. I was able to use it with my iphone 10 and 11 but NOT with my 2018 ipad.

The AliveCor KardiaMobile is great! It is very easy to use and you can carry it around anywhere. All you have to do is to place your fingers on the pads and wait for 30 seconds to get your recording. I like to email me a copy to keep for my files. You can email a copy to your doctor if you like. Great for peace of mind.

The AliveCor device has been outstanding. It is very easy to use and the ability to forward the information to my doctor has been very helpful. I would recommend the device to anyone that has heart related issues, as it gives an individual a piece of mind and comfort knowing the current status of their rate and rhythm.

Fees & costs should be up front.  Gave this as a gift and had no idea that this was so restricted with on going costs if you want to use the service.  This is so sneaky.  When you go online, it wants you to sign up for the service without revealing the hidden costs involved.  I'm very sorry that I purchased this item.

Brilliant the way rhythm strip is produced from digital pulse that has some semblance of an axis and is familiar looking.  It determines rate and rhythm, which is helpful.  Thank you for making it small, affordable and readily available. With the obesity epidemic, Afib is a growing and silent killer. 
--Cardiology PA

This is a fantastic app that I recommend to all my patients. Very easy to use. My only issue that they removed the wipe left to delete journal records. the small arrows are hard to find and you usually end up opening the file--annoying. Other than that it is great. Can save the file and e-mail as a PDF--great feature.

Very helpful tool...used it frequently prior to a cardiac ablation...still use occasionally when I feel out of sorts to confirm my heart rate status.  It's been consistently accurate and reliable.  My only complaint is that it takes me several tries before it starts to read my fingertips, especially in colder weather.

I had a little trouble opening the shrink wrapped package but once it was opened it was a life saver. I would have liked more instruction for a first time user. Especially about how to send the EKG to my doctor.  I didn't realize I had to first convert it to a PDF.  Kardia allowed my doctor to keep track of my events.

I bought this device when I started having intermittent chest discomfort.  It turned out to be atrial fibrillation. I quickly scheduled a visit with my cardiologist and discovered I had several blocked arteries, putting me at substantial risk of a major heart attack.  After surgery, I am once again healthy and happy.

I received this as a gift for Christmas. In April 2020 I went into A Fib late one night and was able to work with the triage nurse on call and not have to call 911.  It happened again the next day & I was able to get help again without calling 911.  Was able to send the ECG to my cardiologist then have a tele visit.

very good consistent reads; easy to use. still affected often by ambient interference and when in motion (locale eg train vs body). needs better functionality to forward readings directly to med team w comments and store to other apps like Notes. may want to consider protective flap for sensors when not being used.

I love the AliveCor mobile ECG, by using this I was able to catch my irregular heart rhythm that always was gone when I went to the doctor. It saved me from an expensive EKG and monitoring system from the hospital. It also has been used to identify my friends husbands tachycardia and PVC rhythm. Awesome product!!!!

The AliveCor was recommended to me by my cardiologist at the Cleveland Clinic, after I was diagnosed with atrial fibrillation & atrial flutter. I have used it at least 300 time in the last 15 months. It has provided me invaluable feedback, teaching me what my symptoms translate to. I now know that what I thought was just an exhausted jittery feeling requiring 5 more cups of coffee to cure is high speed fibrillation/flutter requiring medical attention. I wish I had this years ago when these symptoms started.....I was undiagnosed for likely ten years. My cardiologists have both relied on AliveCor readings I have e-mailed them or shown them in office visits. One cardiac technician told me the AliveCor produces better results than the ECG device in their office. It has helped me recover, understand what literally ticks me off, and how to control my symptoms (I am 7 months post-ablation and doing well, finally). And it is the best cocktail party conversation starter ever....

We purchased this for my husband at the recommendation of his cardiologist after being hospitalized with Afib.  This little machine/app is amazing and so easy to use!  The price is so affordable and worth every cent, especially  for the peace of mind that everything is fine. So happy with our purchase!

I like the Alive cor very much.  it's just not so convenient when one has another case, and have to go looking for where I put the Alive cor to use.  Terrific for those who need to monitor heart rhythm, with a lot more convenience than a holter monitor and especially when disturbances are intermittent.

This device is easy to use. I use it every morning. My only issue is: I think you should be able to print your heart health report without having to purchace any additional services.
Trying to download , print to file, etc. is not to user friendly.
Other than that , this appears to be a great device.

1. Always provides accurate heart rate, even in time of erratic atrial fibrillation. 2. Medication reminder is not that helpful. I need to record multiple doses of the same medication. 3. I would like to have you offer a "sleeve" that fits the phone with the AliveCor device attached - like a DoDo case.

Excellent product which has served me well, although I no longer have episodes of Afib.  I have recommended AliveCor to many others who suffer from arrhythmia and some have purchased the device.  I have also used the device on medical missions to Guatemala, where we have not had access to EKG machines.

Bought two and liked using them. Earlier this year the company no longer supports them in Canada so they are totally useless in Canada. “Upgraded” even erased previously installed app. I bought them on this site and am surprised they are still for sell. 

I was very happy with item when it was usable.

I am very familiar with the tool. It is a good quality device. My main issue is not being able to take off and put back on the sensors, so the phone does not need to remain bulky at all times. In addition, it needs to be able to be used in conjunction with extended batteries--i.e. mophie-type devices.

This is an amazing bit of technology. As a RN with a Master's in IT who has had a lifelong arrhythmia I find this to be awesome!  It is the first time I have been able to record a strip of the arrhythmia. It helps me to monitor episodes and helps my physician and me to track how I am doing. Thank you!

Purchased the KardiaMoble EKG device at the urging of my cardiologist.  Takes accurate and quick Electronic cardio graphs to help the doctor understand/ determine a diagnosis and condition of my heart problem.  Quick and easy to use and less expensive than going to the doctor’s office to have it done

I've only owned it for a week but it work really well. I can leave the KardiaMobile device in the phone clip and take a reading.

My only complaint is the battery cover broke when I first opened it. This could have been designed better. The cover is currently being held in place with a piece of tape.

The unit is not very expensive but does take a pretty good EKG. Using the app, you can specify the length of time you want the EKG to last - from 30 seconds to 5 minutes. It will tell you immediately if afib is observed. There are additional IAP you can get that do more, I didn't pay for any of that

It works fairly well when I've wanted to use it, but it's just too sensitive and inconsistent with signal strength to be practical in terms of regular use with patients and for personal use alike. I have an earlier gen product so it'd be interesting to see how much things have improved from earlier.

I am a physician w/ intermittent A. Fib. Which is controlled w/ beta blockers.  The AlivCor is excellent, I found it far more helpful than other event or holter monitors.  Since I am usually very aware of the irregular rhythm I capture most episodes and log them for later review. Highly recommended

5 of the last 9 readings came up Unclassified.  Tried five or six times today, and got message that the Recording is unreadable due to interference.  The Kardia indicated that it had a good to weak signal during each try.  Using an I Phone.  Also, it is sometimes difficult to connect to the Kardia.

After 5 days in the hospital for A-fib, I bought this as a carry along backup. Was very easy to setup, app loaded with no problems. First recording went fine. 24 hours later I was able to take a reading anytime I want. You can other people.s ekg also because it ask you if this you or some one else.

I had an ablation a few months ago. At follow up I was able to go off meds but the doctor recommended the KardiaMobile. Sure enough a few days later I had a racing heart and of course wondered about Afib. It is great to be able to verify the rate and whether tachycardia, normal, or potential Afib.

My doctor believes that the Kardia unit is worthless.  I have checked it against the Welch Allyn Cardio Perfect workstation and they look like they are in agreement (recorded on 7/8/2021).  My doctor is a gen. practitioner.  I suffer from high blood pressure and am 88 years old ( 140/72 - 45bpm).

Overall the device is very good but it often takes time to get a reading as it resets frequently or does not get enough of a connection requiring a frustrating period of adjustment and time to get a valid reading.   As an improvement I would like to see additional readings and diagnosis beyond AF

I have a-fib and don't usually know when I am out of rhythm.  Taking daily and sometimes several daily readings really makes me feel safer. It is quick and convenient.  I wish everyone with this type problem had one.  It is reasonable priced and the support and feedback is outstanding.  Thank you

Too many surveys, too much email Please communicate no more than once a month.  The unit works fine, the algorithm seems reliable.  Friends are asking for a case to fit iPhone 6s plus.  It seems unusual results should emailed to a doctor's office together with a comment, not directly to a doctor.

I had Afib for many years and recently had an ablation procedure.  This device is very helpful in monitoring my HR and EKG's can be emailed to my doctor's office.  Highly recommended and very easy to set up and use.  For the cost of under $80 it's a must have in keeping track of your heart health

I use the AliveCor app a few times a week to record ECGs. I like that I have the option to send the ECGs to a doctor for review, including my cardiologist. I can't comment on the accuracy of the ECGs as I have never had one at the same time to compare it to, but the AliveCor is very easy to use.

Your service was very useful and helped my doctor better understand  and me to communicate what was going on in my heart in real time. When he did office EKGs I wasn't having an episode. With Alive Cor he could see what happened.  I no longer need your very helpful service. How do I unsubscribe?

Due to recent health concerns, I was concerned about my heart health. I was surprised and delighted by the price and simplicity of this device that gives so much vital information. I highly recommend this product. Getting the reports to my health provider was easy. The monthly plan is optional.

Have tried other more expensive products in the past with very poor results.  This product produces a good waveform with options for variable length.  Setup could be improved by not requiring sending initial recording t company   Recording prints easily to allow for determination of arrythmias.

OK, so this thing is pretty darn handy, when you need it, and I've used it about 350 times since I bought it a few months ago. It has helped to confirm a condition I have been recently diagnosed with (POTS). However, you can't read anything accurately between QRS complexes, and a paid reading will only tell you if your BPM is brady, tachy, or normal/normal unknown origin -- something that anyone with 30 seconds research will already know. Plus, I've gotten a-fib and flutter readings that weren't actually a-fib or flutter. The other downside is you can't get lead 2 when you're standing up and I've never had much luck with the chest readings even though I am thin. That being said, I am SUPER glad to have this bc it is helpful and extremely convenient. Also, the human readings have never taken more than a couple of hours to come back, and most come back in minutes. I think it has a great future, especially in mobile medicine and patient health management.

I love the ease and simplicity of the app and device. I had atrial flutter 8 years ago and despite having an ablation to fix it, it can return or morph into atrial fibrillation. I can now keep on top of it. I have also used it with family and friends. One had a reading of a-fib and she has now scheduled a visit with a cardiologist.

It just so happened that I had an EKG in the doctor’s office on the same day that I used my new Kardia for the first time. The lead I graphs matched perfectly. I also have a FitBit and it’s warning messages match the Kardia. I am very impressed with the simplicity of testing and even more impressed with the accuracy of the results.

Due to a potential heart issue I purchased this device to monitor my health. So far I have used for a couple months and forwarded the results to my cardiologist. The cardiologist was very impressed with the clear readings and information. My only issue is that it's hard to get a good signal with my phone, not a deal breaker though.

I was a skeptic of the system at first but my Doctor told me to get it. The Device is easy to use and gives great readings. I like this version because the batteries can be replaced unlike the card. People have stated that it doesn't save your scans unless you pay for the monthly service but it does. i can review all of my results.

I have been using this device for several months.  The quality of single lead ecg recording is impressive and I found it particularly useful in assessing cardiac rhythmm during my practce or in emergency situation. Tha capability of recognize atrial fibrillation is more than acceptable. A great tool !!  Federico Lombardi, MD, FESC

The AliveCor-KardiaMobile Personal EKG Monitor is priced right, easy to use, highly portable and accurate.  Cardiac personnel should recommend this item for each of their patients.  The information displayed could be a life saver when acted upon when displaying results that are abnormal or a relief when it shows "normal" readings.

Easy and portable EKG monitor. Got this to double check the A-fib alerts I was getting on my Apple watch (I am waiting to see a cardiologist--this does not replace a doctor). It is quick and easy to take an EKG and it keeps all the data in one place. Best of all, you can print a PDF for your doc (or even send it straight to them).

My daughter had some palpitations while training for a marathon. It is important and she is delighted to have the ability to monitor her heart rhythm. She can now record any subsequent events and send them to a cardiologist coincident with a consultation. Technology will further empower patients to participate in their care.  jag

Is there a case available for the I phone 5 SE?

I need to keep case protection on my phone and current case will not fit over attachment plate if I choose to stick it on. Not very convenient to have to remove my case every time I need to do a reading plus having to keep up with kardia device separately. Otherwise, great product.

If you have heart problems or think that you do, this is convenient for catching afib or other intermittent issues. It easily attaches to your phone case. There are other ways to carry around with you too. It is fairly thin, light and relatively inexpensive. App allows you to send the 30 second EKG off to your doctor for viewing.

KardiaMobile probably saved my life. Last Friday I took a reading of 65 bpm the immediately another at 155bpm then 198 bpm. Upon urging from a nurse I went to the ER where they diagnosed me with full blown AFib at 289 bpm. They got me under control with meds and now I’m at 68 bpm. Dr said I just avoided a stroke or heart attack.

Great tool but need more diagnostics to be determined without having to send to tech... For instance warning based off reading , abilty to handle left bundle block detection as normal based on history, definitions for common acronyms used in ecg reads Also need more rugged case and prob watch...definitely lookibg foward to watch

My husband has had 2 successful open heart surgeries, and 2 ablations.  Even with medication he has bout of afib.  This products is always spot on in determining what the heart situation is .  Anyone who has ever experienced afib or aflutter needs this.  I have purchased another 2 and given to friends who have had heart issues.

This came quickly and since I do not have any cardiac abnormalities, I got the basic model no other monitors  and the basic information.  Very happy with it took a perfect ecg watching it I could see no pac or pvc and it showed a nice normal sinus rhythm Good little device in your seventies so you can keep an eye on your heart

If it were not for the convenience  of Alive Corr mobile I would never have a diagnosis. Every time I wore a Halter Monitor I never had an episode. Shortly after purchasing my Alive Cor I had an episode and I recorded. Several more episodes followed. The convenience of having it on your phone made it accessible and convenient.

I a little difficulty downloading the KardiaMobile app on my Apple 8 iphone but once I got it downloaded I was able to navigate the app and run an EKG and it worked very well once I got thru the first test. Instructions sent with the Kardiamobile could be a little more descriptive to help understand how the functions all work.

I have a history of atrial fibrillation, atrial flutter and occasionally atrial tachycardia. The rate is very important to know if my medication is working properly. It is comforting for me to be able to view my rhythm and to send it to my electro physiologist for his purview.  I have been v wry happy with my AliveCor monitor.

The AliveCor device has been invaluable in the detection and classification of palpitations and rhythm disturbances.  It's been especially helpful in identifying paroxysmal atrial fibrillation.  As a result, patients have been started on anticoagulation more promptly.  This has been very helpful in preventing embolic strokes.

This device has proven very helpful on several occasions when Good News volunteers have developed heart problems at home, or while travelling in the Caribbean. It helped avoid a hospital stay for one of them, and avoided numerous office visits for progress checks. It is a great tool for an MD travelling with volunteer groups.

Significant artifact is frequently present. P waves are after not seen limiting the accuracy of the interpretation in pts with frequent PACS. It would be a great help to be able to run an ECG by touching the pads at the pts chest wall (and not only fingers). For now mostly fun but I'd like it to be more clinically useful. Thx

Although not tested for this device, it proved to work just fine.  I initially secured it to the phone with the provided adhesive but that make my protective shell for the phone unusable so I pried it loose. When simply held against the back of the phone (with the silicone bumber still in place) the "velvet" left on the electrodes acts to keep it from slipping about, and after a couple complexes of trash I get a fine tracing.   The electrode unit has had a few troubles with the battery contact, I have had to open it up or tap it strongly a few times but it starts working again.   The sharing options have been very useful.  I actually sent a copy of a reacing labelled "afib" to my electrophysiologist via email attachment. He called me in and I was carfdioverted and my medications adjusted. The device was a great source of curiosity to the hospital staff (I brought it in and used it daily).  Go ahead and stretch this to make and sell a cordless 12 lead machine!

It detects Afibs only. Any other irregular pulse like atrial flatter, PVC and so on  goes like normal or unrecognized. Even "registered doctor" does not describe what he is reading and usually recommends to go ask your own physician. To read the records of AliveCor you have to have some knowledge at least of basic EKG reading

I just bought the AliveCor Kardia Mobile to give as a Gift>

Now I want one for myself... But I have a Pacemaker and I know you have not tested units for Pacemakers and don't recommend using Kardia mobile with a Pacemaker. Have any of your users tried it and reported any results? Please share for information purposes only.

When I first got this around 2017 it was great and helped me a lot. Then in 2022 the sensor failed and I got a new one. This one works but I get to many unclassified readings and know I am in A-fib. but dont feel I can trust the readings any longer?? Even this form is confusing with no SUBMIT button, but a SUBMIT UNDEFINED??

really handy for my mom who has problems telling if she is in a-fib.  Super compact.  

downside: pretty sensitive and needs to be really close to phone.  also constantly annoying you to get an upgrade and cannot find a way to stop it.  Wish base version allowed emailing tracing, but again have to upgrade for any but the most basic functions.
